recipes.title: Glazed Carrots
recipes.description: Simple, healthy glazed carrots with dill and a touch of brown sugar.

instructions.text: Place carrots in skillet.
Mix broth, sugar, dill and white pepper; pour over carrots.
Bring to a boil. Cook, uncovered, until liquid has evaporated and carrots are tender, about 8 minutes.
Stir in lemon juice and serve.

notes: Nutrition per serving: Calories 44, Carbohydrates 9g, Protein 2g, Cholesterol 0, Fat 0g, Sodium 167mg

recipes.title: Homemade Pizza Sauce
recipes.description: A rich, flavorful homemade pizza sauce with tomatoes, onion, and Italian seasonings.

instructions.text: Heat olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, basil, sugar, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes if using.
Bring to a simmer and cook for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened.
Taste and adjust seasonings as needed. Use as pizza sauce or store in refrigerator for up to 1 week.

notes: Instructions inferred from standard pizza sauce technique as original clipping was incomplete.
Sauce can be frozen for up to 3 months.

flags.issue: Instructions inferred from standard technique - original incomplete

recipes.title: German Potato Dumplings
recipes.description: Traditional German potato dumplings (Kartoffelklöße) served with gravy.

instructions.text: Boil potatoes with the skins on.
Let the potatoes cool, then skin and grate.
Add the rest of ingredients and mix well.
Form into balls, drop into boiling water and simmer for 20 minutes.
Take potato balls out with a slotted spoon.
Serve with gravy.

notes: Use starchy potatoes like Russets for best results.
Dumplings are done when they float to the surface.

recipes.title: Golden Green Bean Casserole
recipes.source_note: Publix Apron's recipe card (©2008 Publix Super Markets, Inc.)
recipes.description: A quick and easy green bean casserole with mushroom soup and French-fried onions.

ingredients.item: Sargento Fancy Shredded Sharp Cheddar Cheese

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F. Microwave beans in package on HIGH for 4-5 minutes or until hot. Transfer beans to medium bowl.
Stir in fresh onions and soup until blended. Transfer mixture to 2-quart baking dish.
Top evenly with cheese, then French-fried onions.
Bake 10-15 minutes or until cheese melts, top is browned, and mixture bubbles around edges of the dish. Serve.

notes: Shortcuts and Tips: Don't rinse the pan between cooking the pork and the mushroom sauce. The browned bits in the pan will add extra flavor to the sauce.
Original card appears to be part of a larger meal featuring pork.

recipes.title: Sweet Spiced Calamondins
recipes.source_note: Newspaper clipping - Calamondin Pineapple Preserves feature
recipes.description: Whole spiced calamondins preserved in a sweet syrup, perfect for gifting.

instructions.text: Wash fruit thoroughly. Make a small slit crosswise. Cover with water and bring to a boil; cook 10 minutes; drain.
Make a syrup of sugar, vinegar and water; bring to a boil.
Drop in spices tied in a small clean cloth; cook 5 minutes.
Remove spice bag. Add fruit; cook 10 minutes and let stand overnight to allow fruit to plump.
Bring to a boil and cook until syrup is thick.
Pack hot into hot canning jars, leaving 1/4-inch head space. Adjust caps.
Process 10 minutes in boiling water bath.

notes: These make excellent holiday gifts.
The overnight standing allows the fruit to absorb the syrup and plump up.
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 952.jpeg

recipes.title: Calamondin Pineapple Preserves
recipes.attribution: Lorraine Hottenroth of New Port Richey, Marjorie Rosquist of Holiday, Etea Stasionis of Largo, Gladys Griessner, Lois Kelly of St. Petersburg
recipes.description: A tropical preserve combining calamondins with crushed pineapple and maraschino cherries.

instructions.text: Put all ingredients except pectin into large pot. Bring rapidly to a boil, stirring constantly.
Boil 1 minute. Add pectin; remove from heat; cool 7 minutes, stirring several times.
Ladle into hot, sterilized jars to within 1/8-inch of jar top. Wipe jar rims.
Adjust lids and process in boiling water bath 5 minutes.

notes: Multiple Florida contributors shared versions of this recipe.
The cherries add festive color for holiday giving.

recipes.title: Latkes
recipes.description: Traditional Jewish potato pancakes, crispy on the outside and tender inside.

instructions.text: Squeeze excess water from potatoes. Put in a bowl with lemon.
Beat eggs lightly. Add onion, beaten eggs, matzo meal, salt and pepper. Mix.
Heat 1/4 cup oil in a pan.
Drop potato mixture by tablespoons. Fry until brown.
Drain (keep warm in oven). Repeat.

notes: Traditional for Hanukkah celebrations.
Serve with applesauce and sour cream.
The lemon juice prevents the potatoes from browning.

recipes.title: Microwave Fries
recipes.source_note: Reynolds Microwave Wrap Non-Stick Cooking Paper box
recipes.description: Quick seasoned potato wedges cooked in the microwave with Parmesan cheese.

instructions.text: Place a sheet of Reynolds Microwave Wrap on a microwave-safe plate; set aside.
In a medium bowl, mix garlic salt, paprika, pepper and oil. Cut each potato quarter into 4 or 5 thin wedges. Toss potato wedges in spice mixture until evenly coated.
Arrange potato wedges, cut-side down, on microwave cooking paper-lined plate. Sprinkle potato wedges evenly with Parmesan cheese.
Microwave at HIGH for 5 to 7 minutes or until potatoes are tender, rotating dish once. Let stand 1 minute. Serve immediately.

notes: Quick alternative to oven fries.
Rotate dish halfway through for even cooking.

recipes.title: Kashi Pilaf Side Dish
recipes.description: A simple, nutritious side dish featuring Kashi pilaf with herbs.

instructions.text: Bring water or broth to boil with salt and butter.
Add Kashi, reduce heat, cover and simmer 25 minutes.
Fluff with fork, stir in herbs, and serve.

notes: Use vegetable broth for added flavor

recipes.title: Kashi Verde
recipes.description: Kashi pilaf with fresh green vegetables and herbs.

instructions.text: Melt butter in large skillet.
Add peas, spinach, and green onions; sauté until spinach wilts.
Stir in cooked Kashi and parsley.
Season with salt and pepper.

notes: A bright, fresh way to serve Kashi

recipes.title: Kashi Parmesan
recipes.description: Simple Kashi pilaf enriched with butter and parmesan cheese.

instructions.text: Melt butter in saucepan.
Add cooked Kashi and toss to coat.
Remove from heat and stir in parmesan, parsley, and pepper.
Serve immediately.

notes: Great as a side for grilled meats

recipes.title: Kashi Holiday Stuffing
recipes.description: A wholesome holiday stuffing made with Kashi instead of bread.

instructions.text: Sauté celery, onion, and mushrooms in butter until tender.
Combine with cooked Kashi, broth, and seasonings.
Place in greased 2-quart baking dish.
Bake covered at 350°F for 30 minutes.
Uncover and bake 15 minutes more until top is lightly browned.

notes: Can also be used to stuff a turkey

recipes.title: Kashi Stuffing
recipes.description: A simple, basic Kashi stuffing with traditional seasonings.

instructions.text: Sauté onion and celery in butter until soft.
Mix with Kashi, seasonings, and broth.
Place in greased baking dish.
Bake at 350°F for 35 minutes.

recipes.title: Oven-Baked Fries
recipes.description: Crispy, low-fat oven-baked fries with paprika seasoning.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Scrub the potatoes well; cut into quarters lengthwise, then crosswise.
Place in a bowl; toss with the oil, paprika, salt and pepper.
Arrange the potatoes in a single layer on a baking sheet and bake for 30 minutes, until tender, brown and crispy. Shake once during baking.
Remove from the baking sheet with a metal spatula and serve on a platter. Sprinkle with a little extra salt, if desired.

notes: If you cut up the potatoes ahead of time, keep them in cold water so that they don't discolor

recipes.title: Roasted Red Bell Peppers
recipes.description: Basic broiler-roasted red bell peppers, perfect for salads, sandwiches and omelets.

ingredients.prep_note: stemmed, cut in half lengthwise and seeded

instructions.text: Preheat the broiler. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
Flatten the pepper halves slightly and lay them, skin-side up, on the prepared baking sheet.
Place under the broiler, about 9 inches from the heat source. Broil until the skins are charred (but not to a crisp), about 12 to 15 minutes.
Remove the peppers to a plastic bag, seal and let steam for 15 to 20 minutes.
Slip off and discard the charred skins. Use peppers as directed.

notes: Don't char the peppers too much, or it will be difficult to remove the skins
Keep this recipe handy - roasted peppers perk up salads, sandwiches and omelets

recipes.title: Collard Greens
recipes.source_note: The Lady & Sons Savannah Country Cookbook
recipes.description: Traditional Southern collard greens simmered with smoked meat, butter, and House Seasoning.

ingredients.prep_note: ham hocks, smoked turkey wings or smoked neck bones

instructions.text: In a large pot, bring 3 quarts water to a boil and add smoked meat, House Seasoning, seasoned salt and hot sauce. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 1 hour.

In the meantime, wash collard greens thoroughly. Remove the thick stem that runs down the center of the greens by holding the leaf in your left hand and stripping the leaf down with your right hand. (The tender young leaves of the collards don't need to be stripped.)
Stack 6-8 stripped leaves on top of each other, roll and slice into 1/2- to 1-inch-thick slices.
Place greens in pot with cooked smoked meat. Add butter. Cook 45-60 minutes, stirring occasionally.
When done, taste and adjust seasoning.

notes: House Seasoning: Mix 1 cup salt, 1/4 cup black pepper, 1/4 cup garlic powder. Store in a shaker or other container.

recipes.title: Corn Bread and Sausage Stuffing
recipes.description: A hearty stuffing made with crumbled corn bread, sausage, and McCormick seasonings.

ingredients.item: cooked and coarsely crumbled corn bread

instructions.text: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, celery and bell pepper; cook and stir 5 minutes.
Stir in poultry seasoning, thyme and garlic powder.
Combine corn bread with vegetable mixture and sausage in a large bowl. Add broth; toss gently.
Spoon into a 13 x 9-inch baking dish.
Bake, uncovered, in a 375°F oven 20-25 minutes or until heated through and top is crisp and golden brown.
Prepare Gravy Mix according to package directions. Serve gravy with prepared stuffing.

recipes.title: Patio Potatoes
recipes.description: Skillet potatoes with bacon, cheese, and green peppers.

instructions.text: Melt margarine in skillet, add potatoes, onion and green pepper.
Cook until browned, turning frequently.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Top with cheese and bacon.

recipes.title: Potato Pancakes
recipes.attribution: Eleanor Persky (handed down to Susan Cohen)
recipes.description: Traditional potato pancakes with matzo meal, passed down through the family. Best served with hot corned beef and homemade apple sauce.

instructions.text: Peel and cube potatoes. Place in a food processor with ice water and lemon juice and process until finely grated.
Drain well in fine strainer.
Combine remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Add grated potatoes.
Heat 1/4 inch oil in a large skillet.
Drop batter by heaping tablespoonfuls to form 2 1/2-inch pancakes.
Over medium heat, fry for 1 1/2-2 minutes per side or until brown.
Drain well on paper towels.
Keep warm in a 200°F (95°C) oven until all pancakes are done.

notes: Susan Cohen writes: 'We like these with hot corned beef and homemade apple sauce.'
Use ice water to prevent potatoes from browning

recipes.title: Classic Noodle Pudding
recipes.description: Sweet kugel-style noodle pudding with cream cheese, cottage cheese, raisins, and cinnamon.

instructions.text: Spray 11 × 7 × 2-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
In medium bowl stir cream cheese, cottage cheese, eggs and sugar until well blended.
Stir in raisins, margarine, vanilla and cinnamon.
Add egg noodles; mix well. Pour into prepared baking dish.
Bake in 350°F (175°C) oven 35-40 minutes.
Let stand 20 minutes before serving.

notes: Also known as kugel
Great for holidays or as a side dish

recipes.title: Broccoli & Cheese Casserole
recipes.description: Quick and easy cheesy broccoli casserole with a buttery breadcrumb topping.

ingredients.prep_note: Regular, 98% Fat Free or 25% Less Sodium

instructions.text: Stir soup, milk, mustard, broccoli and cheese in 1 1/2-qt. casserole.
Mix breadcrumbs with butter in bowl and sprinkle over broccoli mixture.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 30 min. or until hot.

notes: Rice is Nice: Add 2 cups cooked white rice to the broccoli mixture.
Cheese Change-Up: Use mozzarella cheese for Cheddar.

recipes.title: Garlic Cauliflower
recipes.description: Simple steamed cauliflower with a garlicky paprika-spiced olive oil dressing - low-carb friendly.

instructions.text: Separate cauliflower into florets. Steam cauliflower in the microwave or boil until tender, about 8-10 minutes. Drain and place in serving bowl.
While cauliflower is cooking, heat olive oil in a small skillet and sauté garlic over medium heat for 1 minute.
Remove from heat and add remaining ingredients. Stir to mix well.
Pour over cauliflower, and serve immediately.

notes: Low-carb: only 2g carbohydrates per serving
91.2% calories from fat - keto friendly

recipes.title: Turkey Dressing
recipes.source_note: Tennessee Pride Country Sausage product recipe
recipes.description: Classic sage and sausage stuffing/dressing - stuff the turkey or bake separately.

instructions.text: Cook sausage in large skillet until browned. Remove with slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Cook onion and celery in drippings in skillet until tender.
Combine sausage, cooked vegetables, sage, marjoram, bread cubes, and parsley in large mixing bowl; blend well.
Stir in chicken broth to moisten. Season with salt and pepper.

Stuff mixture into turkey and roast according to standard roasting directions. Or, dot with butter, cover, and bake in greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish for 30-40 minutes at 350°F (175°C). Uncover and bake 10 minutes or until golden brown.

notes: Can stuff turkey or bake as side dish
Makes about 12 cups

recipes.title: Garlic Potato Sauce
recipes.description: Greek-style skordalia - a creamy garlic and potato sauce/dip with lemon and olive oil.

instructions.text: In a large pot, cover potatoes with water, bring to a boil, and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain potatoes, reserving 1/2 cup of the cooking liquid.
In a food processor or blender, combine potatoes, reserved cooking liquid, garlic, and lemon juice. Pulse to mix, add bread crumbs, and pulse again briefly.
Add olive oil 1 tablespoon at a time, pulsing between additions. Season to taste with salt and pepper and process until smooth and creamy.

recipes.pan_size: Large pot, food processor or blender
notes: Traditional Greek skordalia sauce
Great with grilled meats, vegetables, or bread

recipes.title: Do-The-Hustle Potatoes (Scalloped Potatoes)
recipes.description: Quick scalloped potatoes with evaporated milk and Swiss cheese - ready in 25 minutes.

instructions.text: Bring milk to a boil in a saucepan. Add garlic; reduce heat, and simmer 1 minute. Remove from heat.
Arrange half of potato slices in a 13-by-9-by-2-inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with half of cheese; top with half of milk mixture.
Repeat layers. Bake, uncovered, at 425°F (220°C) for 25 minutes.

notes: Quick and lighter version of scalloped potatoes
Uses evaporated milk for creaminess without heavy cream

recipes.title: Mexicali Corn Casserole
recipes.description: Easy microwave corn casserole with corn bread mix, sour cream, and green chilies.

instructions.text: Place butter in 3-quart casserole. Microwave at high 30 to 60 seconds, or until melted.
Blend in remaining ingredients except paprika.
Microwave at high 2 to 4 minutes, or until cheese melts and mixture begins to set, stirring several times during cooking.
Pour into 8-by-8-inch baking dish. Cover with wax paper.
Reduce power to 50% (medium). Microwave 12 to 18 minutes, or until set, rotating dish 1/4 turn every 3 minutes.
Sprinkle with paprika.

notes: Microwave recipe
Can also bake conventionally at 350°F for 45-50 minutes

recipes.title: Homemade Croutons
recipes.description: Crispy baked Italian-seasoned croutons from sourdough bread.

ingredients.item: cubed sourdough bread or rye bread

instructions.text: Spread cubed sourdough or rye bread in a single layer in a shallow baking dish.
Stir together melted margarine or butter and Italian seasoning; pour over bread cubes. Bake in a 400°F (200°C) oven for 5 to 10 minutes. Stir bake 5 to 10 minutes more or until crisp and brown.

notes: Great on soups and salads

recipes.title: Potato Latkes
recipes.description: Classic Jewish potato pancakes (latkes) for Hanukkah - with humorous editorial notes about the 'optional' onion debate.

instructions.text: Combine all ingredients. Mix well.
Drop pancake mixture by tablespoonsful into a hot skillet generously greased with butter or shortening.
Fry until golden brown on both sides.
Serve hot with applesauce and/or sour cream.

notes: Carol Note: That 'optional' business can make or break your latkes. Better plan on making two batches, one with, one without. Say a blessing before starting - maybe that will help.
Carol Note: Which one, butter or shortening? And what's 'shortening'? Oil? Crisco? How much is [cut off]
Traditional Hanukkah recipe
Serve with applesauce and sour cream

flags.issue: Carol's second note cut off at bottom of image

recipes.title: Onion Roasted Potatoes
recipes.source_note: Lipton Onion Recipe Soup Mix product recipe
recipes.description: Simple and delicious roasted potatoes seasoned with Lipton onion soup mix.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 450°F (230°C).
In large plastic bag, add all ingredients. Close bag and shake until potatoes are evenly coated.
Empty potatoes into shallow baking or roasting pan; discard bag.
Bake, stirring occasionally, 40 minutes or until potatoes are tender and golden brown.
Garnish, if desired, with chopped parsley.

notes: Classic Lipton recipe - simple and delicious
The plastic bag method ensures even coating

recipes.title: Kim Chee (Korean Cabbage Relish)
recipes.description: Traditional Korean fermented cabbage relish with garlic, ginger, and chili - ferment 1-5 days.

ingredients.prep_note: cut into 1½-inch lengths, then shredded lengthwise
finely chopped, or Tabasco to taste

instructions.text: Put cabbage in a bowl and sprinkle with 2 tablespoons salt; mix thoroughly but gently; let stand for 30 minutes.
In small bowl, combine scallions, garlic, red chili pepper and ginger root.
Rinse cabbage twice under running cold water and combine it with scallion mixture and 1 tablespoon salt.
Transfer mixture to an earthenware or glass crock or large jar; add water just to cover and let mixture stand in a cool place, tossing it occasionally, for 1 to 5 days.
Serve the Kim Chee at room temperature or slightly chilled. It may be stored in the refrigerator in a tightly covered jar.

notes: Traditional Korean fermented side dish
Ferment longer for stronger flavor
Store refrigerated in tightly covered jar

recipes.title: Carrot Pudding
recipes.description: A light, soufflé-like carrot dish with orange and dill - elegant enough for company.

instructions.text: Beat egg yolks with sugar until light and fluffy.
Gradually add orange juice. Stir in salt, orange rind, dill and carrots.
Beat egg whites until stiff but not dry; fold in.
Turn into a buttered 1 1/2-quart casserole.
Bake in 350°F (175°C) oven for 30 minutes.

notes: Serve immediately as it will deflate like a soufflé

recipes.title: Carrot-Potato Pancakes
recipes.description: Crispy vegetable pancakes combining shredded carrots and potatoes - a colorful twist on classic latkes.

instructions.text: In medium bowl combine shredded carrots, potato and onion.
Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
Drop by tablespoon on hot greased griddle or skillet.
Spread to form a 3-inch circle.
Cook until golden brown, about 3 minutes on each side, turning once.

notes: Squeeze excess moisture from shredded potato for crispier pancakes

recipes.title: Asparagus Casserole
recipes.description: A layered asparagus casserole with cheese sauce, hard-cooked eggs, and buttery bread crumbs - perfect for Easter dinner alongside ham.

instructions.text: Drain asparagus, reserving liquid; set both aside.
Combine 3 tablespoons butter, flour and salt in a small saucepan. Gradually add milk and 3/4 cup asparagus liquid.
Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens, then add grated cheese and stir until melted.
Sauté bread crumbs with 2 tablespoons melted butter.
In a 2-quart buttered casserole dish, layer half of each of the following ingredients in this order: drained asparagus, sliced eggs, cheese sauce, mushrooms and bread crumbs.
Repeat layers in same order and top with parsley flakes and pimiento.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 30 minutes.

notes: April brings Easter, a day of sunrise services, flowery hats, gaily decorated baskets and family feasting. This asparagus casserole would be a tasty mate for your Easter ham.

recipes.title: Potato Dumplings
recipes.description: Traditional German-style potato dumplings with farina for the perfect texture.

instructions.text: Combine mashed potatoes, butter, egg yolks, flour, farina, and cornstarch.
Season with salt and pepper. Add minced onion if desired.
Let mixture rest 15-20 minutes for farina to absorb moisture.
Bring a large pot of salted water to boiling.
Form mixture into balls (about 2 inches).
Drop dumplings into boiling water. Cook 15-20 minutes until they float and are cooked through.
Remove with slotted spoon. Serve with butter and parsley.

notes: Let dough rest before forming - farina needs time to absorb
Serve with gravy or brown butter

recipes.title: Oven Potatoes
recipes.description: Simple oven-roasted potatoes with a crispy parmesan and flour coating.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Peel potatoes and cut into pieces.
Mix flour and parmesan cheese.
Coat potato pieces in flour-parmesan mixture.
Place on cookie sheet and drizzle oleo over top.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) until brown, about 45 minutes.

notes: Drizzle generously with butter/oleo for crispy coating

recipes.title: Mashed Potatoes
recipes.description: Classic creamy mashed potatoes with butter, milk, and a touch of nutmeg.

instructions.text: Cook 6 potatoes in salted water (2 tsp salt) until tender.
Heat 1 1/2 cups milk.
Drain potatoes and add butter.
Beat potatoes, adding hot milk gradually.
Season with black pepper, salt, and nutmeg to taste.

notes: Heating the milk before adding prevents the potatoes from becoming gluey

recipes.title: Creamy Cheese Grits
recipes.description: Southern comfort food - creamy grits made with chicken broth and sharp cheddar cheese.

instructions.text: Combine chicken broth and whipping cream in a large saucepan.
Bring to a boil.
Stir in grits and return to a boil.
Cover, reduce heat, and simmer 5 to 7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in cheese until melted.
Cool 10 minutes before serving.

notes: For instant grits, use 2 1/3 cups grits and low sodium chicken broth
Classic Southern breakfast side dish
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 908.jpeg

recipes.title: The Lady's Cheesy Mac
recipes.attribution: The Lady & Sons Savannah Country Cookbook
recipes.description: Rich Southern-style baked macaroni and cheese from the famous Savannah restaurant.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Cook macaroni according to package directions; drain.
Place hot macaroni in a large bowl and, while still hot, add the cheddar cheese. Stir to melt.
In a separate bowl, combine beaten eggs, sour cream, butter pieces, salt, and milk.
Add egg mixture to the macaroni mixture and stir to combine.
Pour into a casserole dish.
Bake at 350°F for 30-45 minutes until set.
Top with additional cheese if desired.

notes: From Paula Deen's famous Savannah restaurant
Add cheese while pasta is hot to help it melt

recipes.title: Baked Soy Beans
recipes.description: Old-fashioned baked beans made with soy beans, molasses, and salt pork.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Combine all ingredients except salt pork in a bean pot or casserole dish.
Cook salt pork in frying pan until browned.
Add rendered fat to beans.
Dice the browned salt pork and place on top of beans.
Bake at 350°F for 1 3/4 to 2 hours until bubbly and thickened.

notes: Healthier alternative using soy beans instead of navy beans
Traditional New England style with salt pork

recipes.title: Mashed Whipped Sweet Potatoes
recipes.description: Sweet potato casserole with apples, almonds, and marshmallow topping.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Combine mashed sweet potatoes with almonds, apples, brown sugar, salt, cinnamon, vanilla, and melted butter.
Whip together until well combined.
Place in greased casserole dish.
Cover with mini marshmallows and sprinkle a little brown sugar over top.
Bake at 375°F for 30 minutes until marshmallows are golden.

notes: Classic holiday side dish
Almonds add nice crunch

recipes.title: Brown Rice Cheese Strata
recipes.source_note: newspaper clipping - 'Brown Rice is a Good Side Dish'
recipes.description: Layered casserole with brown rice, cottage cheese, and cheddar.

ingredients.item: tomato slices or green pepper rings

instructions.text: Cook brown rice as directed on package label.
Combine brown rice, cottage cheese, pimiento, egg and salt.
Cook celery and onion in butter until onion is tender, not brown.
Stir into brown rice mixture.
Spoon 1/2 of the brown rice mixture into a 2-quart casserole; sprinkle with 1/2 of the cheese.
Repeat, using remaining brown rice mixture and cheese.
Cover. Bake at 375°F until hot, 25 to 30 minutes.
Sprinkle with paprika. Garnish with tomato slices or green pepper rings, if desired.

notes: Nutritious meatless entree
Brown rice adds fiber and nutty flavor
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 943.jpeg

recipes.title: Herb Brown Rice
recipes.source_note: newspaper clipping - 'Brown Rice is a Good Side Dish'
recipes.description: Savory brown rice cooked with herbs and sautéed vegetables.

instructions.text: Cook brown rice as directed on package label; omit butter and add rosemary, basil and bay leaf to rice while cooking.
Cook celery, mushrooms, and garlic in butter until celery is tender, not brown.
Sprinkle with salt.
Add chives and stir into hot cooked brown rice.
Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

notes: Great side dish for meat, fish or poultry
Herbs added during cooking infuse the rice with flavor
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 944.jpeg

recipes.title: Scalloped Potatoes
recipes.description: Creamy scalloped potatoes using powdered milk, with optional ham.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 2-quart casserole dish.
Peel and thinly slice potatoes. Slice onion.
Melt 3 tbsp margarine over low heat; blend in flour, salt, and pepper.
Cook until mixture is smooth and bubbly; remove from heat.
Stir in SACO Mix'n Drink powder and water. Heat to boiling, stirring constantly.
Arrange 1/3 of the potatoes in prepared casserole dish.
Sprinkle 1/2 the onion and, if desired, ham over potatoes. Pour 1/3 of the milk mixture over all.
Repeat layers. Dot top with 1 tbsp margarine.
Cover and bake 30 minutes. Uncover and bake until potatoes are tender, 60 to 70 minutes longer.
Let stand 5 to 10 minutes before serving.

notes: Nutrition info: 270 calories, 8g fat, 2mg cholesterol, 428mg sodium per serving (without ham)
Can substitute regular milk for powdered milk and water

recipes.title: Vidalia Onion Classic Casserole
recipes.description: Creamy Vidalia onion casserole with sherry and two cheeses.

instructions.text: Sauté sweet onions in butter until they are transparent.
Add chicken broth, sherry and flour. Cook and stir until slightly thickened.
Transfer to a medium casserole.
Top with bread crumbs and both cheeses.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 20 to 30 minutes or until lightly browned and bubbly.
May be prepared ahead of time and refrigerated, then baked.

notes: Can be made ahead and refrigerated before baking

recipes.title: Broccoli Stuffed Baked Vidalias
recipes.description: Vidalia onion halves stuffed with broccoli and topped with cream cheese sauce.

instructions.text: Peel and halve onions. Parboil in salted water 12 minutes; drain.
Meanwhile, microwave or briefly cook the broccoli and drain well.
Remove onion centers, leaving ¾-inch-thick shells.
Chop center portions to equal 1 cup.
Combine broccoli with chopped onions, Parmesan, mayo and lemon juice. Spoon into centers of onion halves.
For sauce, melt the butter in a small saucepan and blend in flour and salt.
Gradually whisk in milk and cook until thick, stirring constantly.
Remove from heat and blend in cream cheese.
Spoon sauce over onion halves and bake, uncovered, at 375°F (190°C) for 20 minutes.

notes: From the Bland Farms Vidalia Onion Cookbook

recipes.title: Libby's Outrageous Onion Cake
recipes.source_note: newspaper clipping (First place winner, onion festival)
recipes.description: Unexpected chocolate cake made with pureed Vidalia onion - first place winner at the onion festival!

instructions.text: Empty cake mix into the large bowl of an electric mixer. Add the eggs.
Puree the diced onion with the oil in a blender.
Add pureed onion mixture to the cake mix bowl and beat until a smooth cake batter forms.
Bake in two greased-and-floured 9-inch round cake pans at 325°F (165°C) for 25 minutes or until done.
Cool and split layers.
Fill with strawberry preserves.
Mix canned chocolate icing with powdered sugar, shortening (Crisco specified by Libby) and water.
Beat at high speed of an electric mixer until the frosting is light and fluffy.
Spread over the top and sides of cake.
Decorate as desired, choosing strawberry slices and/or chocolate shavings.

notes: First place winner at onion festival
Libby is a member of the onion-growing Bland family
The onion adds moisture - you can't taste it!

recipes.title: Orange-Flavored Beans with Tofu
recipes.description: Healthy Asian-inspired stir-fry with tofu, green beans, and orange sauce.

instructions.text: Prepare brown rice according to package directions; keep warm.
While rice is cooking, mix orange juice, red-pepper flakes, ginger, honey, soy sauce, garlic and rice vinegar in glass measuring cup.
Drain tofu; press gently with paper toweling to remove any excess moisture. Cut into ½-inch cubes.
Place tofu in 8x8-inch glass dish. Pour half of orange juice mixture over tofu; cover with plastic wrap; refrigerate to marinate for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, bring large pot of water to boiling. Add green and yellow beans; cook for 3 to 4 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain.
Using knife, remove rind and bitter white pith from orange. Section, removing membranes and seeds. Cut sections into pieces.
Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add beans and red pepper; sauté 5 minutes.
Add remaining orange juice mixture; cook another 3 minutes.
Remove tofu with slotted spoon from marinade and add to skillet; reserve marinade in dish. Stir orange pieces into skillet.
Whisk cornstarch into marinade in glass dish until smooth.
Stir into skillet; cook, stirring occasionally, until sauce thickens and clears, about 3 minutes.
Serve with brown rice. Sprinkle with green onion.

notes: FC Good Food - Pick of the Crop feature

recipes.title: Layered Eggplant
recipes.description: Fried eggplant slices layered with ricotta cheese mixture and topped with fresh tomato sauce.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Cut eggplant crosswise into 18 slices. Pat dry with paper toweling.
Mix together flour, salt and ¼ tsp pepper in shallow dish or onto waxed paper.
Heat ¼ cup oil in each of 2 large skillets over medium-high heat.
Dredge each eggplant slice in flour to coat both sides.
Fry 2 or 3 slices of eggplant per skillet until browned on both sides, about 4 minutes total. Transfer to paper toweling to drain. Repeat until all slices are fried, adding more oil as needed.
Mix cottage cheese or ricotta, Cheddar cheese, parsley, marjoram and remaining pepper in a bowl.

To assemble stacks: In large baking dish, place 1 slice eggplant. Spread on 3 tablespoons cottage cheese mixture; top with eggplant slice, 3 more tablespoons cottage cheese mixture and final slice of eggplant to make 6 stacks. Sprinkle with crumbs.
Bake, uncovered, in 400°F oven for 10 minutes.
Serve immediately with Fresh Tomato Sauce.

Fresh Tomato Sauce: Mix together in bowl 1 large tomato (seeded and diced), 3 tablespoons sliced fresh basil, 3 tablespoons balsamic vinegar, 3 tablespoons olive oil, ¼ tsp salt, and ⅛ tsp freshly ground black pepper. Makes about 1½ cups sauce.

notes: Fresh tomato sauce adds bright flavor

recipes.title: Squash Casserole
recipes.description: Southern squash casserole topped with crumbled cornbread.

instructions.text: Sauté onions in butter until soft.
Add cut up squash and cook until tender (reserve cooking liquid).
Add package of cheese to the hot squash mixture.
Crumble baked cornbread over the mixture.
Add some cooking liquid to moisten.
Transfer to casserole dish.
Bake covered for 1 hour, uncovering the last 30 minutes to brown the top.

notes: Traditional Southern side dish
Temperature inferred - standard casserole temp
Original typed/printed source removed after transcription: Grandmas-recipes - 612.jpeg

recipes.title: Corn Pudding
recipes.description: Fresh corn pudding with ham, eggs, and Parmesan cheese.

instructions.text: Cut corn off 4 ears of corn.
Saute corn in olive oil. Add onions, ham, salt and pepper.
Whisk 6 eggs with 1 cup milk.
Add egg mixture to corn mixture.
Add nutmeg and Parmesan cheese.
Pour into baking dish and bake at 325°F (165°C) for 45 minutes to 1 hour until set.

notes: Great way to use fresh summer corn

recipes.title: Oven Potatoes
recipes.description: Crispy oven-baked potato wedges coated in flour and Parmesan cheese.

instructions.text: Mix flour and Parmesan cheese together.
Cut potatoes into wedges and coat in flour-cheese mixture.
Place on cookie sheet.
Drizzle melted oleo (or butter) over top.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) until done, about 45 minutes.

notes: Simple and delicious side dish

recipes.title: No-Stir Polenta
recipes.description: Easy oven-baked polenta that requires no stirring - adjust water for desired consistency.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a heavy, ovenproof, 12-inch saucepan.
Add polenta, water, butter and salt to pan. Stir with a fork until blended. (It will separate and won't come together until more than half of the cooking time has elapsed.)
Bake, uncovered, for 1 hour and 20 minutes.
Stir the polenta with a long-pronged fork, add salt to taste, and bake 10 minutes longer.
Remove from the oven; let rest for 5 minutes before pouring into a buttered bowl.
Serve simply with butter or Parmesan cheese; serve as a side dish as a collector for the main course's sauces; or use as a base for other recipes.

notes: Water consistency guide: Very soft polenta = 12 cups water; Soft = 10 cups; Medium = 8 cups; Very firm = 6 cups

recipes.title: Millet Pilaf with Nuts
recipes.description: Aromatic millet pilaf with cinnamon and toasted nuts - serve hot or at room temperature.

instructions.text: Heat butter and olive oil in a heavy saucepan. Add onion; cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until soft and starting to color.
Add cinnamon and millet; cook for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring constantly.
Pour in water or stock; add salt and white pepper. Bring to a boil, cover and cook over very low heat for about 25 minutes, until the millet is tender and all the liquid has been absorbed.
Uncover and let sit for a few minutes to let the steam escape, then fluff with a fork.
Heat vegetable oil in a small skillet; add nuts. When they start to turn golden, remove pan from heat, lift nuts out with a slotted spoon and drain on absorbent paper.
With a fork, stir half of the nuts through the millet pilaf, then sprinkle the remaining nuts over the top.
Serve hot with a vegetable accompaniment such as beans in tomato sauce. In warm weather, serve the pilaf at room temperature with a salad such as tomato and spring onion.

notes: Vegetable stock is easily obtained by reserving the water used to cook vegetables for your daily meals

recipes.title: Hoppin' George
recipes.description: A twist on traditional Hoppin' John using pearled barley instead of rice with black-eyed peas.

ingredients.item: bacon bits or chopped cooked bacon

instructions.text: Saute onion and barley in oil until barley is slightly brown, about 5 to 7 minutes.
Add black-eyed peas, stock, bacon and salt.
Cover tightly and simmer until tender, about 1 hour.

notes: Traditional Southern New Year's dish variant
Barley adds a chewy, nutty texture different from rice

recipes.title: Quinoa with Dried Cherries and Cashews
recipes.description: Colorful quinoa salad with orange dressing, saffron, dried cherries and toasted cashews.

instructions.text: Whisk together olive oil, orange juice, orange zest, 1 tablespoon mint, and salt and pepper to taste. Set aside.
Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan over high heat. Add quinoa and saffron. [UNCLEAR - instructions cut off]
[GUESS] Reduce heat and simmer until quinoa is tender and water is absorbed, about 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Bread + Butter Pickles
recipes.description: Classic bread and butter pickles with mustard and celery seed.

instructions.text: Slice cucumbers and onions.
Heat vinegar, sugar, mustard seed, celery seed, and turmeric.
Pack cucumbers and onions in jars.
Pour hot brine over cucumbers and seal.

recipes.title: Meatless Red Beans and Rice
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 161
recipes.description: Adjust the amount of ground red pepper to give this dish the zing you like.

ingredients.item: dry red beans or dry red kidney beans

instructions.text: Rinse beans. In a large saucepan combine beans and 3 cups water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Cover and let stand 1 hour. (Or, soak by placing beans and 3 cups water in a bowl. Cover and set in a cool place for 6 to 8 hours or overnight.)

Drain beans in a colander and rinse. Return beans to the saucepan. Stir in onion, garlic, bay leaf, salt, fennel seed, red pepper, and 3 cups fresh water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 2 1/2 hours or till beans are tender, adding more water, if necessary, and stirring occasionally.
Uncover and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 15 to 20 minutes more or till a thick gravy forms. Discard bay leaf. Serve over rice. Serves 4.

notes: Meaty Red Beans and Rice: Prepare as above, except omit salt and fennel seed. Add 1/2 pound smoked pork hocks or meaty ham bone with onion. When beans are tender, remove hocks or ham bone. Cut meat from bones or bone. Discard bones or bone and return meat to bean mixture along with 1/2 pound smoked sausage, cut into bite-size pieces.
Red Beans and Corn Bread: Prepare as above, except omit rice and spoon bean mixture over squares of corn bread.

missing_inputs: Not in database: fennel seed, crushed

recipes.title: Meatless Tacos
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 162

ingredients.item: tofu (fresh bean curd), drained and finely chopped

instructions.text: Rinse lentils; drain. In a medium saucepan combine lentils, onion, and 1 1/2 cup water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 30 minutes or till tender and liquid is absorbed.
Stir tomato sauce and seasoning mix into lentils. Simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes. Stir in tofu; heat through. Spoon into taco shells. Top with lettuce, tomato, cheese, and salsa. Serves 4.

notes: Bulgur Tacos: Prepare as above, except substitute bulgur for lentils. Cover and simmer bulgur, onion, and 3/4 cup water about 10 minutes or till tender and liquid is absorbed.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Bean and Cheese Burritos
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook, page 162

instructions.text: Stack six 8-inch flour tortillas and wrap in foil. Heat in a 350° oven for 10 minutes to soften. In a skillet cook 1 cup chopped onion in 1 tablespoon cooking oil till tender. Add one 16-ounce can refried beans. Cook and stir till heated through.

Spoon about 1/4 cup bean mixture onto each tortilla just below center. Divide 1 1/2 cups shredded cheddar cheese among tortillas. Fold edge nearest filling up and over just till mixture is covered. Fold in 2 sides just till they meet; roll up.
Place on a baking sheet. Bake in a 350° oven about 10 minutes or till heated through. Serve with shredded lettuce and salsa. Serves 3.

notes: Bean and Cheese Chimichangas: Prepare as above, except use 10-inch flour tortillas and omit baking. Secure rolled-up tortillas with wooden toothpicks. In a 3-quart saucepan fry tortillas, 2 or 3 at a time, in 1 inch hot cooking oil (375°) about 1 minute on each side or till golden. Drain. Keep warm in a 300° oven. Remove picks. Pass dairy sour cream and guacamole.

nutrition.source: Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis

recipes.title: Garbanzo Sandwich Spread
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Serve this spread for lunch in pita bread or on bagels, or as appetizer on party rye bread.

instructions.text: In a blender container or food processor bowl combine beans, tahini, juice, oil, garlic, paprika, and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Cover, blend or process till smooth, scraping sides as necessary. Transfer to a bowl. Stir in parsley and pimiento. Cover; chill 2 to 24 hours.

notes: Mediterranean Sandwich: Spread about 1/3 cup cold Garbanzo Sandwich Spread on 1 slice whole wheat bread. Top with 2 tomato slices, 1 slice Swiss or brick cheese, and another slice bread. Makes 1 serving.
Tahini Substitute: Stir together 3 tablespoons creamy peanut butter and 1 tablespoon sesame oil till well combined. Makes 1/4 cup.

Blend in rice and broccoli.
Pour mixture in buttered baking dish. Sprinkle top with crumbled onion rings.

notes: Bake Setting – Not for Timer
Strawberries and raspberries are ideal for this recipe

recipes.description: Sweet cream cheese spread with fruit preserves.

instructions.text: Beat cream cheese and preserves on medium speed until fluffy.

recipes.title: Whipped Honey-Orange Spread
recipes.description: Light and fluffy honey butter with orange zest.

instructions.text: Beat all ingredients on medium speed until fluffy.

assumptions: Estimated 4 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Country Corn Bread Dressing
recipes.source_note: Aunt Jemima corn bread mix package
recipes.description: Traditional Southern-style corn bread dressing perfect for stuffing turkey or as a side dish.

instructions.text: Heat oven to 350°F.
Sauté celery and onion in margarine until tender.
Combine celery mixture and remaining ingredients.
Toss lightly until bread is thoroughly moistened.
Place in 8-inch square baking dish or 1-1/2-quart casserole.
Bake 40 to 45 minutes or until heated through.
Alternatively, lightly stuff dressing into body and neck cavities of one 12-pound turkey; roast according to standard roasting directions.

notes: Dressing can also be prepared using 1/2 pan crumbled corn bread (about 3 cups) and 3 cups soft bread cubes
Can be used as stuffing for a 12-pound turkey

recipes.title: Cranberry Salad
recipes.description: Traditional cranberry gelatin salad with pineapple and nuts - a holiday classic.

instructions.text: Add juice of pineapple to the unflavored gelatin to dissolve.
Dissolve Jello in hot water, add cold water.
Grind cranberries in a food processor.
Add sugar to cranberries, mix well.
When Jello begins to thicken, fold in cranberry mix and remainder of ingredients.
Pour into a large mold or serving dish.

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Cranberry Orange Pecan Butter Roll
recipes.description: Festive compound butter with cranberries, orange zest, and pecans - perfect for holiday bread.

instructions.text: Divide the dried cranberries and pecans in half. Place 1/4 cup of cranberries and 1/4 cup of pecans in a small bowl and set aside.
Combine the butter, 1/4 cup cranberries, zest and 1/4 cup of pecans in a large mixing bowl.
Place the butter mixture onto a 12" x 12" piece of wax paper.
Fold the top of the wax paper over the butter mixture and press into a log shape.
Place the butter log into the freezer for 30 minutes to harden.
Remove the butter from the freezer and remove the wax paper.
Roll the butter in the remaining mixture of cranberries and pecan until the outside is fully coated.
Refrigerate until needed.

notes: Great for holiday entertaining
Can be made ahead

recipes.title: Spaetzle
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 263
recipes.description: Serve spaetzle (SHPETS-luh) with sauces or in soups as you would noodles. Or serve it with sauerbraten, the traditional German way.

instructions.text: In a large saucepan or Dutch oven bring about 3 quarts lightly salted water to boiling.
Meanwhile, for spaetzle batter, in a bowl stir together flour and salt. In another bowl stir together egg and milk. Stir egg mixture into the flour mixture.
Set a colander with large holes (at least 3/16-inch diameter) on a large piece of waxed paper.

Pour the spaetzle batter into the colander. Immediately hold the colander over the pan of boiling water; press the batter through the colander with a wooden spoon to form the spaetzle. Cook about 5 minutes or till done, stirring occasionally. Drain well.
Melt margarine or butter; toss with bread crumbs. Sprinkle crumb mixture over the hot spaetzle.

notes: Whole Wheat Spaetzle: Prepare as above, except reduce all-purpose flour to 1/2 cup and add 1/2 cup whole wheat flour.
Pesto Spaetzle: Prepare as above, except omit margarine and crumbs. Toss hot cooked spaetzle with 1 portion (about 1/4 cup) Pesto for Pasta (see recipe, page 269).

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 263)

recipes.title: Homemade Pasta
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 266
recipes.description: In recipes that call for packaged pasta, substitute half of this recipe for each 4 ounces of the packaged product.

instructions.text: In a large mixing bowl stir together 2 cups of the flour and the salt. Make a well in the center of the mixture. In a bowl combine eggs, water, and oil. Add to flour mixture; mix well.
Sprinkle kneading surface with the remaining flour. Turn dough out onto floured surface. Knead till dough is smooth and elastic (8 to 10 minutes). Cover and let rest for 10 minutes.
Divide dough into fourths. On a lightly floured surface, roll each fourth into a 12x12-inch square (about 1/16 inch thick). Let stand 20 minutes. Cut as desired.
Or, if using a pasta machine, pass dough through machine according to manufacturer's directions till 1/16 inch thick. Cut as desired.
Cook pasta (see chart, page 278), allowing a few more minutes for dried or frozen pasta. Drain well.

To store: After cutting and shaping the pasta, hang it from a pasta drying rack or clothes hanger, or spread it on a wire cooling rack. Let dry overnight or till completely dry. Place in an airtight container and refrigerate for up to 3 days. Or, dry the pasta for at least 1 hour. Seal it in a freezer bag or freezer container. Freeze for up to 8 months.

notes: Whole Wheat Pasta: Prepare as above, except substitute whole wheat flour for the all-purpose flour.

Spinach Pasta: Prepare as above, except increase all-purpose flour to 2 3/4 cups, reduce water to 1/4 cup, and add 1/4 cup very finely chopped cooked spinach, well drained, to the egg mixture. Makes 1 1/4 pounds fresh pasta (10 servings).
Herb Pasta: Prepare as above, except add 1 teaspoon dried basil, marjoram, or sage, crushed, to flour mixture.

Egg Noodles: Prepare as above, except substitute 1 egg plus 2 egg yolks for the 2 eggs. Reduce flour to 1 3/4 cups in flour mixture and 1/4 cup for kneading. Cut dough into 1/4-inch-wide strips, then cut into 2- to 3-inch lengths.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 266)

recipes.title: Herb-Buttered Pasta
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 267
recipes.description: Simple herb-tossed pasta that makes a delicious side dish.

ingredients.item: dried basil, oregano, thyme, or marjoram, crushed; dried dillweed; or caraway seed

instructions.text: Cook pasta (see chart, page 278). Drain well.
Return to hot saucepan. Add margarine and desired herb. Toss gently till pasta is well coated.
Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serves 4.

notes: Lemon-Chive Pasta: Prepare as above, except omit herb and add 1/4 cup snipped chives and 1 teaspoon finely shredded lemon peel with margarine or butter.
Nutty Cheese Pasta: Prepare as above, except omit herb and add 1/2 cup chopped walnuts, pecans, or almonds and 2 tablespoons grated Parmesan or Romano cheese with margarine.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 267)

recipes.title: Couscous and Tomatoes
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 269
recipes.description: Try quick-cooking rice in place of the couscous.

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine undrained stewed tomatoes, onion, pepper, garlic powder. Bring to boiling. Stir in couscous; remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Stir in olives and parsley. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 269)

recipes.title: Rice Mold
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 272
recipes.description: Plain or perked up, rice shaped into a mold turns an ordinary meal into special dinner.

ingredients.item: long grain rice or brown rice

instructions.text: In a saucepan combine water or broth, rice, and salt. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 15 minutes for long grain rice (35 minutes for brown rice) or till rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
Press hot rice into a buttered 3-cup mold or bowl. Unmold at once. Makes 4 servings.

notes: Parsley Rice Mold: Stir 1/4 cup snipped parsley into cooked rice.
Confetti Rice Mold: Stir in 1/2 cup frozen mixed vegetables and 1/4 teaspoon dried dillweed with the uncooked rice.
Peppery Rice Mold: Stir in one 4-ounce can diced green chili peppers, drained, and 1/8 teaspoon ground red pepper with the uncooked rice.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 272)

recipes.title: Risotto
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 272
recipes.description: Parmesan flavors this creamy rice dish.

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan cook mushrooms, rice, and green pepper in margarine till green pepper is tender. Remove from heat.
Stir in broth, water, sherry, sage, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 15 minutes or till tender.
Remove from heat. Let stand, covered, for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Serves 4.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 272)

recipes.title: Spanish Rice
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 272
recipes.description: Classic tomato-flavored rice with peppers and onion.

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook onion, green pepper, and garlic in oil till tender but not brown.

Stir in undrained tomatoes, rice, sugar, chili powder, 1/8 teaspoon pepper, several dashes hot pepper sauce, and 1 cup water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes or till rice is tender and most of the liquid is absorbed. Sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese, if desired.

notes: Mexican Rice: Omit onion, green pepper, garlic, and cooking oil. Substitute stewed tomatoes for canned tomatoes. Stir in one 4-ounce can diced green chili peppers, drained, and 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 272)

recipes.title: Rice Pilaf
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 273
recipes.description: Add a nutty flavor to the rice by browning it lightly in margarine or butter before beginning the recipe.

ingredients.item: instant chicken or beef bouillon granules

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook onion, mushrooms, celery or green pepper, and garlic in margarine till tender but not brown.

Stir in rice, bouillon granules, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and 1 1/2 cups water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 15 minutes or till rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Stir in crumbled bacon.

notes: Curried Rice Pilaf: Omit mushrooms and add 1/4 to 1 teaspoon curry powder with onion. Stir in 1/2 cup raisins with rice.
Brown and Wild Rice Pilaf: Substitute 1/2 cup brown rice and 1/4 cup wild rice for the long grain rice. Cook rice mixture about 40 minutes.
Bulgur Pilaf: Substitute bulgur for the long grain rice.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 273)

recipes.title: Baked Gnocchi
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 275
recipes.description: Baking makes the Parmesan-flavored gnocchi (NYAH-kee) extra crisp.

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan heat milk and margarine to boiling. Mix 1/3 cup milk, the farina, and salt. Slowly add farina mixture to boiling milk, stirring constantly. Cook and stir 3 to 4 minutes or till thick.

Remove from heat; stir about 1/3 cup of the hot mixture into egg. Return all to the saucepan; stir in the 1/3 cup Parmesan cheese. Pour into a well-buttered 10x6x2-inch baking dish. Chill about 1 hour or till firm.

Turn out of baking dish onto a cutting board. Cut into 3x1-inch rectangles. Sprinkle tops with the 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese. Place on a well-greased baking sheet. Bake in a 425° oven about 25 minutes or till golden.

notes: Spinach Gnocchi: Reduce milk to 1 1/4 cups. Cook one 10-ounce package frozen chopped spinach. Drain well. Stir spinach into hot farina mixture.
Boiled Gnocchi: Do not pour into baking dish. Cool slightly. Shape mixture into compact balls. Drop into gently boiling water. Cook about 4 minutes.
Herb-Garlic Gnocchi: Omit salt and stir in 1 teaspoon dried basil, oregano, or marjoram, crushed, and 1/2 teaspoon garlic salt with the farina.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 275)

recipes.title: Choose-a-Grain Casserole
recipes.source_note: Better Homes and Gardens New Cookbook, page 275
recipes.description: Great with baked chicken or fish.

ingredients.item: chopped green or sweet red pepper
cooked rice, bulgur, wheat berries, or barley

instructions.text: In a small saucepan cook pepper, onion, celery, and garlic in margarine till tender.
Meanwhile, in a bowl combine cooked grain, cream cheese, salt, and pepper. Stir in onion mixture. Transfer to a 1-quart casserole.
Bake, covered, in a 375° oven for 25 minutes or till heated through. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 2 to 3 minutes more or till cheese melts.

assumptions: From Better Homes and Gardens cookbook nutrition analysis (p. 275)

recipes.title: Old-Fashioned Bread Stuffing
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic sage-seasoned bread stuffing for poultry.

ingredients.item: poultry seasoning or dried sage leaves

instructions.text: In a small saucepan cook celery and onion in margarine or butter till tender but not brown.
Stir in poultry seasoning or sage, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon salt.
Place dry bread cubes in a bowl. Add onion mixture. Drizzle with enough broth or water to moisten, tossing lightly. Use to stuff one 8- to 10-pound turkey. Makes 8 to 10 servings.

notes: Microwave directions available in original
Variations: Mushroom Stuffing, Giblet Stuffing, Oyster Stuffing, Chestnut Stuffing, Peanut or Raisin Stuffing, Herb and Onion Stuffing

recipes.title: Harvest Stuffing
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Apple and walnut bread stuffing with wheat germ.

instructions.text: In a large skillet cook carrots, celery, and onion in margarine or butter till tender. Stir in nutmeg, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper.

In a bowl combine bread cubes, apple, walnuts, and wheat germ. Add carrot mixture. Drizzle with enough broth to moisten, tossing lightly. Use to stuff one 8- to 10-pound turkey. Makes 8 to 10 servings.

recipes.title: Corn Bread and Bacon Stuffing
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Southern-style stuffing with corn bread and bacon.

instructions.text: In a skillet cook chopped bacon, celery, and onion over medium heat till bacon is crisp and vegetables are tender. Do not drain.

Meanwhile, in a bowl combine eggs, parsley, poultry seasoning, and pepper. Add Corn Bread and bread cubes; toss lightly till mixed. Add bacon mixture. Drizzle with enough of the broth to moisten, tossing lightly till mixed. Use to stuff one 8- to 10-pound turkey or domestic goose. Makes 8 to 10 servings.

recipes.title: Wild Rice Stuffing
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Delicious nutty stuffing with wild rice, mushrooms, and almonds.

ingredients.item: toasted slivered almonds or pine nuts

instructions.text: Rinse wild rice in a strainer under cold water about 1 minute. In a medium saucepan combine wild rice, brown rice, bouillon granules, sage or nutmeg, and 1 cup water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat.

Cover and simmer for 45 minutes. Add mushrooms, celery, and green onions. Cook, covered, over medium-low heat for 10 to 20 minutes more or till vegetables are just tender, stirring frequently. Stir in nuts, if desired. Use to stuff one 2 1/2- to 3-pound broiler-fryer chicken. (Or, add 1/4 cup water and transfer to a 1-quart casserole. Bake in a 375° oven for 25 to 30 minutes.) Makes 6 servings.

notes: Apricot-Wild-Rice Stuffing variation available

recipes.title: Bulgur Pilaf Stuffing
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Hearty stuffing with bulgur wheat and turkey sausage.

ingredients.item: pork sausage or ground turkey sausage

instructions.text: In a small saucepan bring broth and Worcestershire sauce to boiling. Add bulgur. Remove from heat. Cover and let stand for 15 minutes.
In a medium skillet crumble sausage; add onion, celery, and carrot. Cook about 6 minutes or till sausage is no longer pink and vegetables are tender, stirring often to break up large pieces.
Drain. Stir in bulgur mixture. Use to stuff one 2 1/2- to 3-pound broiler-fryer chicken. Serves 6.

notes: Microwave directions available

recipes.title: Yorkshire Pudding
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Classic British accompaniment to roast beef

instructions.text: After removing roast from oven, increase oven temperature to 450°F.
In a bowl combine 4 eggs and 2 cups milk. Add 2 cups all-purpose flour. Beat with a rotary beater till smooth.
Add 2 tablespoons beef drippings from roast pan to batter; stir.
Pour batter into a 13x9x2-inch baking pan.
Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or till puffy and golden. Season to taste.

notes: Best served immediately while still puffy

assumptions: Inferred 1.0 for beef drippings from roast (standard quantity)
Estimated 8 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Oven-Browned Potatoes
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Roasted potatoes cooked alongside the roast

instructions.text: Peel and quarter 5 medium potatoes. Cook in boiling salted water for 10 minutes. Drain.
About 30 to 40 minutes before roast is done (the roast temperature should be about 100°), add 1/2 cup water to pan. Arrange potatoes around roast, turning to coat.

assumptions: Estimated 6 servings based on total calories

recipes.title: Artichokes with Butter Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Pluck a leaf and dip it into the sauce. Then savor the flavor as you scrape off the tender flesh with your teeth.

ingredients.item: dried dillweed, tarragon, oregano, or chervil, crushed

instructions.text: Wash artichokes; trim stems and remove loose outer leaves. Cut 1 inch from each top; snip off the sharp leaf tips. Brush the cut edges with a little lemon juice.

In a large saucepan or Dutch oven bring a large amount of lightly salted water to boiling. Add artichokes. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 20 to 25 minutes or till a leaf pulls out easily. Drain upside down.
Meanwhile, for butter sauce, melt butter or margarine. Stir in dillweed, tarragon, oregano, or chervil and the 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Turn artichokes right side up and serve with the butter sauce.

notes: Artichokes with Sour Cream Sauce: Prepare as above, except chill cooked artichokes thoroughly. For sauce, omit butter or margarine and the 1 tablespoon lemon juice. Reduce dillweed, tarragon, oregano, or chervil to 1/8 teaspoon. Combine 1/2 cup dairy sour cream, 1 1/2 teaspoons milk, 1/4 teaspoon Dijon-style mustard, the herb, and dash onion powder. Cover and chill the sauce at least 2 hours before serving with chilled artichokes.

recipes.title: Artichokes au Gratin
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: If you like, make this creamy vegetable dish ahead and chill. To heat, just pop the dish into a 350° oven for 25 to 35 minutes or till it's bubbly.

instructions.text: Cook artichokes according to package directions; drain. Combine Parmesan cheese, dry bread crumbs, and paprika; stir in the 1 teaspoon softened margarine or butter. Set aside.

For sauce, in a medium saucepan cook mushrooms in the 1 tablespoon margarine over medium-high heat about 3 minutes or till almost tender. Stir in flour, mustard, marjoram, 1/8 teaspoon salt, and dash pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till bubbly. Stir in cheese till melted. Add artichoke hearts. Transfer to a 1-quart casserole. Sprinkle crumb mixture over vegetables. Bake in a 350° oven about 20 minutes or till bubbly.

recipes.title: Asparagus Dijon
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: asparagus spears or two 10-ounce packages frozen asparagus spears

instructions.text: Snap off and discard woody bases from fresh asparagus. If desired, scrape off scales. Cook, covered, in a small amount of boiling water for 8 to 10 minutes or till crisp-tender. (Or, cook frozen asparagus according to the package directions.) Drain; keep warm.
For sauce, in a mixing bowl beat whipping cream just till stiff peaks form. Fold in chopped egg, mayonnaise or salad dressing, onion, and mustard. Spoon sauce atop asparagus. Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Sesame Asparagus
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: For added lemon flavor, pass lemon wedges.

ingredients.item: asparagus spears or one 10-ounce package frozen cut asparagus

instructions.text: Snap off and discard woody bases from fresh asparagus. If desired, scrape off scales. Cut into 1-inch pieces. Cook, covered, in a small amount of boiling water for 6 to 8 minutes or till crisp-tender. (Or, cook frozen asparagus according to package directions.) Drain; remove from pan.

In the same pan melt margarine; add sesame seed. Cook and stir 2 to 3 minutes or till toasted. Add mushrooms; cook and stir till tender. Add lemon juice and, if desired, sesame oil. Add asparagus; toss to coat. Heat through.

recipes.title: Green Beans Amandine
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: green beans or one 9-ounce package frozen cut or French-style green beans

instructions.text: Cut fresh beans into 1-inch pieces or, for French-style, into lengthwise slices. Cook, covered, in a small amount of boiling water 20 to 25 minutes for cut beans (10 to 12 minutes for French-style beans) or till crisp-tender. (Or, cook frozen beans according to package directions.) Drain.
Meanwhile, cook and stir almonds in margarine over medium heat till golden. Remove from heat; stir in lemon juice. Stir almond mixture into beans.

recipes.title: Creamy Green Bean Bake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: package frozen French-style green beans or one 16-ounce can French-style green beans
can semicondensed cream of mushroom soup
dairy sour cream or plain yogurt

instructions.text: Cook frozen green beans according to package directions; drain. (Or, drain canned beans.) In a 1-quart casserole combine soup, sour cream, and pimiento. Stir in beans. Bake in a 350° oven 20 to 25 minutes or till bubbly. Sprinkle with onions. Bake 5 minutes more.

recipes.title: Creole-Style Green Beans
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: package frozen cut or French-style green beans, or one 16-ounce can cut or French-style green beans

instructions.text: Cook frozen beans according to package directions; drain. (Or, drain canned beans.) Cook onion and basil in margarine till tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in beans, tomato, ham, and dash pepper. Cook, covered, 1 to 2 minutes more or till heated through.

recipes.title: Cheesy Bean Combo
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: package frozen baby lima beans (2 cups)
frozen cut green beans or whole kernel corn
dairy sour cream or plain yogurt

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan bring 1/2 cup water to boiling. Add lima beans and onion. Return to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 7 minutes. Add green beans or corn and cook 5 minutes more. Drain; return to saucepan.

Meanwhile, in a bowl stir together sour cream and flour; stir in milk. Stir sour cream mixture and cheese into drained vegetables. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly, then cook and stir 1 minute more.

recipes.title: Lima Beans and Mushrooms
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: package frozen baby lima beans or small peas, or one 9-ounce package frozen cut green beans

instructions.text: Cook beans or peas according to package directions. Drain; keep warm.

Meanwhile, in a small skillet cook garlic and basil in margarine or butter over medium-high heat for 30 seconds. Add mushrooms and cook for 3 to 4 minutes or till tender. Stir into cooked beans or peas. Season to taste.

recipes.title: Baked Bean Quintet
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: can pork and beans with tomato sauce
onion, sliced and separated into rings (optional)

instructions.text: In a skillet cook chopped onion, bacon, and garlic till bacon is done and onion is tender but not brown; drain. In a bowl combine onion mixture, lima beans, pork and beans, kidney beans, butter beans, garbanzo beans, catsup, molasses, brown sugar, mustard, and Worcestershire sauce.
Transfer bean mixture to a 3-quart casserole or bean pot. Bake, covered, in a 375° oven for 1 hour. If desired, garnish with onion rings.

notes: Crockery-cooker directions: Use main recipe ingredient amounts and assemble as above. Transfer to a 3 1/2- or 4-quart electric crockery cooker. Cover; cook on low-heat setting for 10 to 12 hours or on high-heat setting for 4 to 5 hours. If desired, top with onion rings.

recipes.title: Baked Beans
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Boston often gets credit for this dish, but it was popular throughout colonial America.

ingredients.item: dry navy beans or dry great northern beans
bacon or salt pork, cut up

instructions.text: Rinse beans. In a 4 1/2-quart Dutch oven combine beans and 8 cups cold water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Cover and let stand for 1 hour. (Or, skip boiling the water and soak beans overnight in a covered pan.) Drain and rinse beans.
In the same pan combine beans and 8 cups fresh water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer about 1 1/4 hours or till tender, stirring occasionally. Drain beans, reserving liquid.
In a 2 1/2-quart casserole or bean pot combine the beans, bacon, and onion. Stir in 1 cup of the reserved bean liquid, the molasses or maple syrup, brown sugar, dry mustard, salt, and pepper.
Bake, covered, in a 300° oven about 2 1/2 hours or to desired consistency, stirring occasionally. If necessary, add additional reserved bean liquid.

recipes.title: Shortcut Baked Beans
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Easy to whip up for a potluck or picnic.

ingredients.item: can pork and beans in tomato sauce

instructions.text: In a skillet cook bacon till crisp. Remove bacon, reserving 1 tablespoon of the drippings. Drain and crumble bacon. Set aside. Cook onion in reserved bacon drippings over medium heat till tender but not brown.

To bake in the oven, in a 1 1/2-quart casserole combine onion, pork and beans, catsup, brown sugar or molasses, mustard, and Worcestershire sauce. Bake in a 350° oven about 1 hour or to desired consistency. Stir bean mixture; top with bacon. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

To cook on top of the range, in a medium saucepan combine onion, pork and beans, catsup, brown sugar, mustard, and Worcestershire sauce. Cook over low heat about 15 minutes or to desired consistency, stirring frequently. Top with bacon.

recipes.title: Harvard Beets
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The sweet-and-sour flavor makes these bright red beets an all-time favorite.

ingredients.item: medium beets or one 16-ounce can sliced or diced beets

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan cook fresh whole beets, covered, in boiling water 40 to 50 minutes or till tender. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup liquid. Cool slightly. Slip off skins and slice or dice. (Or, drain canned beets, reserving 1/2 cup liquid.) In a medium saucepan combine reserved liquid, sugar, vinegar, and cornstarch. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir 2 minutes more. Stir in beets and margarine. Heat through.

recipes.title: Orange-Glazed Beets
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: medium beets or one 16-ounce can sliced beets, drained

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook fresh whole beets, covered, in boiling water 40 to 50 minutes or till tender; drain. Cool slightly; slip off skins and slice.

In a medium saucepan melt margarine or butter. Stir in brown sugar and cornstarch. Stir in orange peel and juice. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Add sliced beets; cook and stir for 3 to 4 minutes or till heated through.

recipes.title: Broccoli Oriental
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: broccoli, cut up, or one 10-ounce package frozen cut broccoli

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan cook fresh broccoli and water chestnuts, covered, in a small amount of boiling water for 9 to 11 minutes or till crisp-tender. (Or, cook frozen broccoli and water chestnuts according to broccoli package directions.) Drain; transfer to a bowl. Keep warm.
In the same saucepan melt margarine or butter. Stir in soy sauce and red pepper. Heat through. Pour over broccoli.

assumptions: Inferred 0.25 for Dash ground red pepper (standard quantity)

recipes.title: Golden Broccoli Bake
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: broccoli, cut up (6 cups), or one 16-ounce package frozen cut broccoli
can semicondensed cream of mushroom soup

instructions.text: Cook fresh broccoli, covered, in a small amount of boiling water for 9 to 11 minutes or till crisp-tender. (Or, cook frozen broccoli according to package directions.) Drain. Transfer to a 1 1/2-quart casserole. Combine soup, cheese, milk, mayonnaise, and pimiento. Stir into broccoli. Top with crushed crackers. Bake in a 350° oven about 30 minutes or till heated through.

recipes.title: Curried Brussels Sprouts
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: brussels sprouts or one 10-ounce package frozen brussels sprouts

instructions.text: Halve large fresh brussels sprouts. Cook, covered, in a small amount of boiling water 10 to 12 minutes or till crisp-tender. Drain. (Or, cook frozen sprouts according to package directions.) Drain. Halve any large sprouts.) Set aside. In the same casserole cook mushrooms and curry powder in margarine 3 to 4 minutes or till tender. Stir in flour and bouillon granules. Add 1/2 cup water. Cook and stir till bubbly. Stir in sprouts; heat through. Top with nuts.

recipes.title: Creamy Brussels Sprouts
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Mustard adds a mild but distinctive flavor to the sour cream sauce.

ingredients.item: brussels sprouts or one 10-ounce package frozen brussels sprouts
dairy sour cream or plain yogurt

instructions.text: Halve large fresh brussels sprouts. In a medium saucepan cook fresh sprouts, covered, in a small amount of boiling water for 10 to 12 minutes or till crisp-tender. Drain and remove from pan. (Or, cook frozen sprouts according to package directions; drain and remove from pan. Halve any large sprouts.)

In the same saucepan cook onion in margarine or butter till tender. In a bowl combine milk, sour cream or yogurt, flour, mustard, and salt. Add to saucepan. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in brussels sprouts; heat through.

recipes.title: Pennsylvania Red Cabbage
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: Serve this crisp, tangy side dish with baked fish or pot roast.

instructions.text: In a large skillet stir together brown sugar, vinegar, oil, caraway seed, 2 tablespoons water, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and dash pepper. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes or till hot, stirring occasionally. Stir in cabbage and apple. Cook, covered, over medium-low heat for 10 to 12 minutes or till crisp-tender, stirring occasionally.

recipes.title: Pecan-Cabbage Toss
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: In a large saucepan combine cabbage, carrot, onion, 2 tablespoons water, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Toss to mix. Cook, covered, over medium heat for 5 to 7 minutes or till crisp-tender, stirring once. Drain. Combine margarine and mustard. Stir in pecans. Pour over cabbage mixture; toss. Season to taste.

recipes.title: Brown-Sugar-Glazed Carrots
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: small or medium carrots, parsnips, or turnips, peeled

instructions.text: Cut carrots or parsnips in half both crosswise and lengthwise. (Or, cut turnips into 1/2-inch cubes.) In a medium saucepan cook carrots or parsnips, covered, in a small amount of boiling water for 7 to 9 minutes (10 to 12 minutes for turnips) or till crisp-tender. Drain vegetables; remove from pan.

In the same saucepan combine margarine or butter, brown sugar, and dash salt. Stir over medium heat till combined. Add carrots, parsnips, or turnips. Cook, uncovered, about 2 minutes or till glazed, stirring frequently. Season to taste with pepper.

recipes.title: Sweet-and-Sour Carrots
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: sliced carrots or frozen crinkle-cut carrots

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan cook fresh carrots, covered, in a small amount of boiling water for 7 to 9 minutes or till crisp-tender. (Or, cook frozen carrots according to package directions.) Drain; remove from pan. In the same saucepan combine onions, juice, honey, margarine, vinegar, cornstarch, and soy sauce. Cook and stir till bubbly. Add carrots. Cook and stir till heated through.

recipes.title: Carrots in Almond Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: baby carrots or medium carrots, sliced into 1-inch pieces

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan cook carrots, covered, in a small amount of boiling water for 15 to 20 minutes or till crisp-tender. Drain; remove from pan.

In the same pan melt margarine. Add almonds and onion. Cook and stir over medium heat for 3 to 5 minutes or till almonds are golden and onion is tender. Stir in cornstarch. Add bouillon granules, dillweed, 1/4 cup water, and dash pepper. Cook and stir till thickened and bubbly. Stir in carrots; heat through.

recipes.title: Cauliflower in Cheese Sauce
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: head cauliflower, broken into flowerets (2 cups)

instructions.text: In a saucepan cook cauliflower, covered, in a small amount of boiling water for 8 to 10 minutes or till crisp-tender. Drain; remove from pan.
In the same pan melt margarine. Stir in flour and dash pepper. Add milk all at once. Cook and stir till bubbly. Stir in cheese till melted. Add cauliflower and mushrooms; heat through.

recipes.title: Nutty Cauliflower
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book
recipes.description: The pecans and garlic butter subtly flavor the sweet pepper and cauliflower.

ingredients.item: head cauliflower, broken into flowerets (2 cups)
medium green or sweet red pepper, cut into bite-size strips

instructions.text: Cook cauliflower, covered, in a small amount of boiling water for 8 to 10 minutes or till crisp-tender. Drain; transfer to a serving bowl.
Meanwhile, in a medium skillet cook green pepper and garlic in margarine till tender. Pour over cauliflower; toss. Stir in pecans.

recipes.title: Creamy Curried Corn
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

ingredients.item: cut fresh corn or one 10-ounce package frozen whole kernel corn
chopped green or sweet red pepper

instructions.text: In a medium saucepan combine 2 cups cut fresh corn or one 10-ounce package frozen whole kernel corn, 1/4 cup chopped onion, 1/4 cup chopped green or sweet red pepper, 1/2 teaspoon instant chicken bouillon granules, 1/2 teaspoon curry powder, and dash pepper. Stir in 1/4 cup water. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 5 to 7 minutes or till corn is crisp-tender. Do not drain. Stir in one 3-ounce package cream cheese, cubed. Stir over low heat till melted. If necessary, stir in 1 to 2 tablespoons milk to make of desired consistency.

notes: Creamy Creole Corn: Prepare as above, except omit curry powder. Add 1/8 teaspoon ground red pepper with the corn. Stir in 3/4 cup chopped tomato after the cream cheese melts.

recipes.title: Corn on the Cob
recipes.attribution: Better Homes and Gardens New Cook Book

instructions.text: Remove the husks from fresh ears of corn; scrub with a stiff brush to remove silks. Rinse. Cook, covered, in a small amount of lightly salted boiling water (or, uncovered, in enough boiling water to cover) for 5 to 7 minutes or till tender. If desired, serve with margarine or butter.
