recipes.title: Cheesy Garlic Bread
recipes.description: Classic cheesy garlic bread - perfect side for pasta dishes.

instructions.text: Heat your oven to 400 degrees F.
Cut loaf down the middle and place on a baking pan.
In a small bowl, mix together the butter, olive oil, garlic, and parsley.
Spread the butter mixture over the bread.
Top each side of the bread with cheese.
Bake for 5-8 minutes.
Remove from the oven and cut into strips.

recipes.title: Roasted Asparagus
recipes.description: Simple roasted asparagus with honey-balsamic glaze.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 400 degrees F.
Mix the garlic, olive oil, honey, vinegar, and salt in a small bowl.
Place the asparagus on a lined baking sheet.
Pour the mixture evenly over the asparagus.
Roast for 15 minutes.

recipes.title: Sriracha Zucchini
recipes.description: Spicy stir-fried zucchini with ginger, garlic, and Sriracha.

instructions.text: Heat a large saucepan over medium heat and add the olive oil.
Stir in the ginger and the garlic and cook for 3-5 minutes.
Add the zucchini and cook for about 2 minutes.
Add the soy sauce, sesame oil, and Sriracha sauce. Stir well.
Cook for an additional 2 minutes.
Top with fresh cilantro before serving.

notes: This is a great side dish for Goldie Chicken.

recipes.title: Honey Glazed Carrots
recipes.description: Sweet and tangy glazed carrots with honey and red wine vinegar.

instructions.text: Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet.
Add the carrots and cook for about 2 minutes.
Add the broth, honey, vinegar, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Bring to a boil then reduce to a simmer. Cover and cook for 10 minutes.
Uncover and cook until carrots are tender and liquid has thickened, about 8-9 minutes.
Remove the skillet from the heat and add in butter and stir.

recipes.title: Mediterranean Vegetables
recipes.description: Sautéed zucchini, onion, and bell pepper with Greek seasoning.

instructions.text: Cut the zucchini into eighths lengthwise, then in half crosswise.
Add 2 tbsp of olive oil to a large skillet and heat over medium-high heat.
Add the zucchini, onion, and bell pepper to the skillet. Cook and stir for 6-8 minutes.
In a small bowl, whisk together 2 tsp olive oil, Greek seasoning, balsamic vinegar, garlic salt, and sugar.
Remove the skillet from the heat and drizzle on oil/seasoning mixture and toss well to coat.
Serve immediately.

notes: Serve immediately.

recipes.title: Lebanese Rice Pilaf
recipes.description: Classic Lebanese rice pilaf with orzo pasta, toasted almonds, and tahini.

instructions.text: First we need to get a nice sized container for our rice. Fill the container with water and place the rice into it.
Let everything relax for about 10 mins. Now remove the rice from the water and run cool water over the rice until you notice the water running clear.
Grab a frying pan or skillet and heat the pan with a medium level of heat.
Add 2 tbsps of olive oil with one fourth cup of butter to the pan and mix into the oils some orzo.
Fry your orzo down until you notice it becoming a nice brownish color. This will take about five mins.
Now that the orzo is brown let's grab our rice and increase the level of heat slightly (should be high at this point).
For 5 mins we want to mix into the oil orzo mixture all the rice and continue cooking until we notice that the rice kernels are translucent.
Grab some water and cover the rice with it. Combine with the water and rice some salt and get everything to a boiling point.

Grab a lid and cover the rice. Make sure you turn the heat down to its lowest level and let the rice cook until it becomes fluffy. Make sure to not open the pot while the rice is cooking (we need the pressure to build up inside the pot).
Continue cooking your rice for about 20 mins.
Now grab another frying pan or skillet and get some olive oil hot. Heating level should be medium.

Add some almonds to the oil mix and fry them until they are nice and toasted. You will eventually notice a nice fragrance from the cooked almonds. Overall the almond frying process should take about 5 mins.
Finally we want to add some butter and tahini to the almonds and evenly cover each almond with the mixture.
Combine the almond mixture with the rice and plate the contents. Enjoy.

notes: Let everything relax for about 10 minutes before cooking.

Make sure you turn the heat down to its lowest level and let the rice cook until it becomes fluffy. Make sure to not open the pot while the rice is cooking (we need the pressure to build up inside the pot).
Add some almonds to the oil mix and fry them until they are nice and toasted. You will eventually notice a nice fragrance from the cooked almonds.
Overall the almond frying process should take about 5 minutes.

recipes.title: Lebanese Garlic Sauce
recipes.description: A smooth, creamy garlic sauce made by blending garlic with olive oil.

instructions.text: Blend salt, garlic, and lemon juice at medium speed until smooth.
Gradually add olive oil in a slow stream while blending.
Continue until thick. Refrigerate in a sealed container.

recipes.title: Lebanese Garlic Sauce II
recipes.description: A mayonnaise-like garlic sauce made with an immersion blender.

instructions.text: Combine oils, garlic, and lemon juice in a quart jar.
Blend with immersion blender until thick and mayo-like.

recipes.title: Cilantro and Garlic Potatoes
recipes.description: Crispy fried potatoes tossed with a cilantro, garlic, cumin, and lemon dressing.

instructions.text: Deep fry potatoes at 375°F (190°C) for 8 min. Drain.
Fry garlic and cilantro 5 min. Toss with potatoes, lemon, salt, and cumin.

recipes.title: Fried Cauliflower with Tahini Sauce
recipes.description: Crispy deep-fried cauliflower florets served with a creamy tahini sauce.

instructions.text: Make tahini sauce by blending tahini, water, garlic, parsley, lemon, salt, pepper.
Fry cauliflower at 375°F (190°C) for 8 min. Serve with tahini sauce.

recipes.title: Air-Fryer Carrots
recipes.description: I love roasting carrots to bring out their sweetness. I think thyme really complements the flavor of these air-fryer carrots, but feel free to mix it up and use other herbs, like rosemary or tarragon.

instructions.text: Preheat air fryer to 375°. In a large bowl, toss first 8 ingredients. Place carrots on greased tray in air-fryer basket. Cook until carrots are crisp-tender, 18-20 minutes, stirring occasionally. If desired, sprinkle with fresh thyme.

recipes.title: Air-Fryer Hard-Boiled Eggs
recipes.description: Air-fryer hard-boiled eggs make cooking eggs easier than we ever imagined, and they turn out just the same as stove-cooked eggs. It is a kitchen shortcut for the win!

instructions.text: Preheat your air fryer to 275°F. Once the air fryer is ready, place all six eggs in a single layer on the tray of your air fryer basket. Cook the eggs for 15 minutes. Editor's Tip: In our testing, we find cook times vary dramatically between brands of air fryers. As a result, be sure to check your eggs after 15 minutes. If one isn't done enough, place the remaining eggs back in the tray for a few more minutes.

Remove the eggs from the air fryer gently and rinse them under cold water. This begins halting the cooking process. Once rinsed, place the eggs in ice water until they're completely cooled. Make sure the shells don't crack against the ice.

If you're not going to use the eggs right away in a recipe, drain them and place them in the refrigerator unpeeled. Editor's Tip: You can also remove the shells before storing the eggs for easier grab-and-go access.

recipes.title: Air-Fryer Potatoes
recipes.description: Red potatoes tossed with olive oil and herbs will become your new staple side. Crisp and fluffy air-fryer potatoes go with just about anything, from burgers to pork chops or prime rib.

ingredients.item: 2 pounds small unpeeled red potatoes, cut into wedges
1 tablespoon minced fresh rosemary or 1 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed

instructions.text: Preheat the air fryer to 400°F. In a bowl, drizzle the potatoes with olive oil, then sprinkle them with the rosemary, garlic, salt and pepper. Gently toss everything together to evenly coat the potatoes with the oil and seasonings.
Arrange the potatoes evenly on an ungreased tray in the air-fryer basket. Cook until the potatoes are golden brown and tender, 10 to 12 minutes, stirring the potatoes once.

recipes.title: Asparagus, Squash & Red Pepper Saute
recipes.description: The appealing vegetable trio is enlivened by a wine-scented saute.

ingredients.item: 2 medium yellow summer squash, halved and cut into 1/4-inch slices
6 ounces fresh asparagus, trimmed and cut into 1-1/2-inch pieces
1/4 cup white wine or vegetable broth

instructions.text: In a large cast-iron or other heavy skillet, saute the peppers, squash and asparagus in wine and oil until crisp-tender. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Hummus
recipes.description: This perfectly delicious pumpkin hummus dip is a beautiful blend of creamy, decadent hummus and warm, autumnal pumpkin.

ingredients.item: 1 can (15 ounces) garbanzo beans or chickpeas, rinsed and drained
1/4 cup olive oil or pumpkin seed oil
2 tablespoons pumpkin seed oil or olive oil, optional
1/4 cup salted pumpkin seeds or pepitas
Baked pita chips and sliced apples and pears

instructions.text: In a food processor, combine the drained chickpeas, canned pumpkin, tahini, olive oil or pumpkin seed oil, orange juice, sesame oil, cumin, garlic and salt. Cover and process until smooth, stopping and scraping the sides as needed.

Once smooth and creamy, transfer the hummus to a serving dish or bowl. Garnish with pumpkin seed oil (if desired), and top with pumpkin seeds and pomegranate seeds. Serve with crispy pita chips and sliced apples and pears.

recipes.title: Green Beans Amandine
recipes.description: It's hard to improve on the taste of fresh green beans, but this recipe for green beans amandine does it. The final dish looks fancy without requiring fancy cooking skills.

ingredients.item: 1 pound fresh or frozen green beans, cut into 2-inch pieces

instructions.text: Add the beans and 1/2 cup of water to a large skillet or saucepan. Bring the water to a boil, then cover the pan and cook the beans until they're crisp-tender, 10 to 15 minutes. Drain the beans and set them aside.
In a large skillet, cook the almonds in the butter over low heat; the longer you cook them, the more brown they'll turn. Stir in the lemon juice and, if desired, add the seasoned salt.
Add the beans to the skillet and heat the whole mix through.

recipes.title: Lemon-Parmesan Broiled Asparagus
recipes.description: These special spears are packed with flavor, thanks to the lemon-garlic dressing they're tossed in before roasting. It's a simple, quick side that goes with almost anything.

instructions.text: Preheat broiler. In large bowl, combine the first 6 ingredients. Add asparagus; toss to coat. Place in a single layer on a wire rack over a foil-lined 15x10x1-in. baking pan.
Broil 5-6 inches from heat until tender and lightly browned, 5-7 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter; sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. If desired, serve with lemon wedges.

recipes.title: Maple-Gingerroot Vegetables
recipes.description: My family loves this recipe because it brings out the lovely flavors of the vegetables. Even my children enjoy it

ingredients.item: 1 large sweet potato, peeled and cubed
1 large sweet onion, cut into wedges
1 small red onion, cut into wedges

instructions.text: Place first 7 ingredients in a large bowl; add oil, ginger, salt and pepper. Toss to coat. Arrange vegetables in a single layer in two 15x10x1-in. baking pans coated with cooking spray.
Bake, uncovered, at 425° for 25 minutes, stirring once. Drizzle with syrup. Bake until vegetables are tender, 20-25 minutes longer, stirring once more.

recipes.title: Roasted Asparagus
recipes.description: This roasted asparagus recipe is made in a foil packet in the oven, keeping the spears bright and green with a consistently crisp texture.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Place the asparagus on a large piece of heavy-duty foil. Dot the asparagus with the butter.
Bring the edges of the foil together and seal the packet tightly. Place the foil packet on a baking sheet.

Bake until the asparagus is crisp-tender, 25 to 30 minutes. Carefully open the foil to allow the steam to escape. Season the asparagus with salt and pepper. Editor's Tip: Whether you grill foil packets or use them in the oven like in this recipe, open them with caution. Put on oven mitts or grill gloves before you break the seal, or use a long skewer to poke a hole in the packet to release the steam before you open it completely.

recipes.title: Pimiento Green Beans
recipes.description: Here's an easy way to turn everyday green beans into a special side dish. Pimientos, Parmesan cheese and chicken broth add savory flavor and a dash of color.

ingredients.item: 2 pounds fresh green beans, cut into 2-inch pieces

instructions.text: In a large saucepan, bring beans, broth and onion to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and cook until crisp-tender, 10-15 minutes. Drain. Stir in pimientos, salt and pepper. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

recipes.title: Roasted Fall Vegetables
recipes.description: I love serving this tender veggie side dish as part of a comforting dinner on a chilly night. The cayenne pepper lends zippy flavor that's not overpowering.

ingredients.item: 1 large acorn squash, peeled and cut into 1-1/2-inch cubes
1 large rutabaga, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
1 medium pie pumpkin or butternut squash, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes
3 large carrots, peeled and cut into 1-1/2-inch pieces
1 medium parsnip, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the first five ingredients. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Pour over vegetables; toss to coat.
Transfer to 2 greased 15x10x1-in. baking pans. Bake, uncovered, at 425° for 40-50 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally.

recipes.title: Roasted Peppers and Cauliflower
recipes.description: Caramelization really enhances the flavors in this easy side dish. The seasoned, roasted peppers and cauliflower are just right with nearly any main course.

ingredients.item: 1 medium head cauliflower, broken into florets
2 medium sweet red peppers, cut into strips

instructions.text: Place the cauliflower, red peppers and onions in a shallow roasting pan. Add the oil, salt and pepper; toss to coat. Roast, uncovered, at 425° for 20 minutes.
Stir; roast 10 minutes longer or until vegetables are tender and lightly browned. Transfer to a serving bowl; sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and parsley.

recipes.title: Zucchini and Summer Squash Side Dish
recipes.description: I’m trying to cut my risk for cardiac disease by changing the way I eat. This colorful sauteed zucchini and summer squash side dish is packed with as much nutrition as fresh-picked flavor!

ingredients.item: 1 medium yellow summer squash, quartered and sliced
1 medium sweet red pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces

instructions.text: In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat; add yellow squash, zucchini, onion and red pepper. Cook and stir 5 minutes. Add garlic and seasonings; cook until vegetables are crisp-tender, 2-3 minutes. Stir in tomato; heat through.

recipes.title: Tabbouleh
recipes.description: Take a break from green leaf salads, and enjoy a bright, lively tabbouleh salad. This parsley-and-bulgur salad tastes great on its own, and it pairs well with foods from Middle Eastern and Mediterranean cuisines.

instructions.text: Prepare the bulgur according to the package directions. Let cool. Editor's Tip: Once the bulgur is cooked, run a fork through the grains to fluff them up. Then leave uncovered while you prepare the remaining ingredients.

Transfer the bulgur to a large bowl. Stir in the parsley, tomatoes, onion, lemon juice, oil, mint, salt, pepper and cayenne. Editor's Tip: The most time-consuming part of this preparation is picking your parsley. Don't worry if there's a small stem here or there. They will all get incorporated into the dish, and no one will be the wiser. Our guide on how to cut basil and other common herbs has more tips.
If desired, chill the tabbouleh before serving. Editor's Tip: Taste for seasoning, and add more salt or lemon juice as needed.

recipes.title: Veggie Kabobs
recipes.description: Grilling is a delightful way of preparing the season's freshest produce. The zesty Italian marinade adds just the right amount of spice to these veggie kabobs.

instructions.text: In a small bowl, mash garlic with salt to form a paste. Stir in the oil, lemon juice, Italian seasoning and pepper.
Thread vegetables alternately onto metal or soaked wooden skewers; place in a shallow pan. Pour garlic mixture over kabobs; let stand for 15 minutes.
Grill kabobs, covered, over medium heat for 10-15 minutes or just until vegetables are tender, turning frequently.

recipes.title: Bacon-Corn Stuffed Peppers
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Filled with corn, salsa, green onions, mozzarella cheese and bacon, these grilled pepper halves are sure to liven up your next cookout. They have a wonderful taste and give a fun twist to the usual corn on the cob.

ingredients.item: 1 medium green pepper, halved and seeded
1 medium sweet red pepper, halved and seeded

instructions.text: In a large bowl, combine the corn, salsa and onions. Spoon into pepper halves. Place each stuffed pepper half on a piece of heavy-duty foil (about 18x12 in.). Fold foil around peppers and seal tightly.

Grill, covered, over medium heat until peppers are crisp-tender, 25-30 minutes. Carefully open packets to allow steam to escape. Sprinkle with cheese and bacon. Return to the grill until cheese is melted, 3-5 minutes. Serve with additional salsa if desired.

recipes.title: Oven-Fried Squash
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Our oven-fried squash recipe is about as easy as they come. It's a crispy, crunchy way to use a bumper crop of summer squash.

ingredients.item: 4 cups thinly sliced yellow summer squash (3 medium)

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 450ºF. Place the sliced squash into a large bowl. Add the olive oil and toss to coat. Add the salt, pepper and cayenne and toss again to thoroughly coat the squash with the seasonings.
In a shallow dish, mix the panko and Parmesan cheese. Dip the squash pieces into the breading mixture, flipping to coat both sides. Place the breaded squash on parchment-lined baking sheets.

Bake the squash for 10 minutes, then rotate the baking pans. Continue to bake for an additional 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown and crispy. Remove the pans from the oven and serve the oven-fried squash hot.

recipes.title: Beans, Bacon & Tomato Bake
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Bacon, tomatoes and lima beans combine for a nutrient-packed side dish that makes the perfect accompaniment to turkey.

ingredients.item: 2 cans (14-1/2 ounces each) diced tomatoes, undrained
8 cups frozen lima beans (about 42 ounces), thawed

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°. In a 6-qt. stockpot, cook bacon, onion, celery and green pepper over medium heat until bacon is crisp and vegetables are tender. Add garlic; cook 1 minute longer. Stir in flour, sugar, salt and pepper. Add tomatoes. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly; cook and stir 1-2 minutes or until thickened. Stir in beans.
Transfer to a greased 3-qt. baking dish or a 13x9-in. baking pan. Bake, covered, 35-40 minutes or until beans are tender.

recipes.title: Mexican-Style Pinto Beans
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: This Mexican-Style pinto beans recipe delivers rich, savory flavor and incredible versatility

ingredients.item: 2 cans (14-1/2 ounces each) reduced-sodium chicken broth
2 cans (14-1/2 ounces each) Mexican diced tomatoes, undrained

instructions.text: Rinse the dried pinto beans well, then briefly cover them in at least two inches of cold water. Discard any beans that float. Place the beans in a Dutch oven (or a large pot, if needed) and add enough fresh water to cover them by two inches.
Bring the pinto beans to a rolling boil, and let them boil for two minutes. Then, cut the heat, cover the Dutch oven (or pot), and let the beans sit for one hour.

Drain the beans and give them a quick rinse, then add them back into the Dutch oven. Then, stir in the broth and all ingredients except the tomatoes (and cilantro) and bring the mixture to a boil. Once you've achieved a boil, reduce the heat to a simmer and cook everything for another hour, or until the beans are tender.

Once the beans are cooked enough to be tender, pour in the canned tomatoes with their liquid and stir the dish to combine everything well. Let the mixture simmer for another 20 to 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, then serve and enjoy your Mexican-Style pinto beans.

recipes.title: Carrots and Snow Peas
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: This is without question my favorite side dish, both for flavor and ease of preparation. Sherry adds an amazing spark to the vegetables.

instructions.text: In a large cast-iron skillet or wok, stir-fry carrots in butter for 3 minutes Add the snow peas, shallot and salt; stir-fry 2 minutes longer or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Stir in sherry; heat through.

recipes.title: Cauliflower Mash
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: This quick and easy mashed cauliflower is a wonderful alternative to same-old mashed spuds, and it's healthier, too!

instructions.text: Place cauliflower in a large saucepan; add water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer, covered, until tender, 10-12 minutes. Drain; return to pan.

Meanwhile, combine remaining ingredients in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Immediately remove from heat and strain; discard garlic, peppercorns and bay leaf. Add broth to cauliflower. Mash to reach desired consistency.

recipes.title: Cilantro Ginger Carrots
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Peppery-sweet ginger and cooling cilantro have starring roles in this colorful side of crisp-tender carrots. The veggie goes from pan to plate in a twinkling.

instructions.text: In a large cast-iron or other heavy skillet, heat butter over medium-high heat. Add carrots; cook and stir until crisp-tender, 4-6 minutes. Add ginger; cook 1 minute longer. Stir in cilantro, salt and pepper.

recipes.title: Cilantro Potatoes
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Fresh cilantro gives an exotic Syrian-style flavor to these easy, delicious skillet potatoes. They’re a creative complement to Mom’s tangy kabobs.

instructions.text: In a large cast-iron or other heavy skillet, cook cilantro and garlic in oil over medium heat for 1 minute. Add potatoes; cook and stir until tender and lightly browned, 20-25 minutes. Drain. Sprinkle with salt.

recipes.title: Colcannon
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Putting together your St. Patrick's Day feast? Make sure there's room for colcannon, one of Ireland's most famous potato dishes, on the table.

ingredients.item: 4 pounds medium potatoes (about 8), peeled and quartered

instructions.text: Place the cabbage and 2 cups water in a large saucepan, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, and simmer, covered, until the cabbage is tender, about 10 minutes. Drain the cabbage, and reserve the cooking liquid. Keep the cabbage warm in a separate dish.

In the same saucepan, combine the potatoes with the reserved cooking liquid from the cabbage. Add additional water as needed to cover the potatoes, and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, and cook, uncovered, until the potatoes are tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Editor’s Tip: The potatoes are done cooking when a fork pierced into them glides right through their middles.
Meanwhile, place the milk, green onions, salt and pepper in a small saucepan. Bring just to a boil, and remove the saucepan from heat.

Drain the potatoes. Place the potatoes in a large bowl, and mash. (Don't overmash the potatoes, or they'll come out goopy and gluey!) Add the milk mixture, and mash just until blended. Fold in the cabbage. To serve, drizzle with butter, and top with the bacon and parsley. Editor’s Tip: After draining the potatoes, let them cool to the point where they’re no longer steaming. Steaming potatoes are evaporating excess moisture, which is great because no one likes a watery mash!

recipes.title: Confetti Quinoa
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: If you have never tried quinoa, start with my easy side, brimming with colorful veggies. I serve it with orange-glazed chicken.

instructions.text: In a large saucepan, bring water to a boil. Add the next 5 ingredients. Reduce heat; simmer, covered, until liquid is absorbed, 12-15 minutes.
Stir in lemon juice and oil. Remove from heat; fluff with a fork.

recipes.title: Corn Okra Creole
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: This dish is representative of my area of the country, and particularly the Texas-Louisiana border. The okra, corn and Creole seasonings are all popular here.

ingredients.item: 2 cups fresh or frozen corn or 1 can (15-1/4 ounces) whole-kernel corn
1-1/2 cups sliced fresh or frozen okra
3 medium tomatoes, peeled and chopped (1-1/2 cups)

instructions.text: In a large skillet, saute green pepper and onion in oil until tender. Add corn and okra; cook over medium heat for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in the tomatoes, tomato paste, thyme, salt, pepper and, if desired, pepper sauce. Cover and simmer for 3-5 minutes, stirring occasionally.

recipes.title: Cranberry Wild Rice Pilaf
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: This tender side dish is perfect for the holidays or any time you want to add a special touch. Dried cranberries, currants and almonds serve up color and texture. My co-workers all make this rice pilaf for their families.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°. In a saucepan, combine wild rice and broth; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, covered, 10 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in barley, currants and butter. Transfer to a greased 1-1/2-qt. baking dish.
Bake, covered, until wild rice and barley are tender, 50-60 minutes. Stir in almonds and cranberries.

recipes.title: Dutch Beets
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Even people who typically shy away from beets will polish these off. This healthy canned vegetable recipe is quick to make, too, since you start with canned beets.

instructions.text: Drain beets, reserving 1 cup liquid. In a saucepan, heat butter over medium-high heat; saute onion until tender. Stir in flour until blended. Gradually stir in reserved beet liquid. Bring to a boil; cook and stir until thickened, about 2 minutes. Stir in remaining ingredients and beets; heat through.

recipes.title: Quinoa Tabbouleh
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: We put a gluten-free twist on a classic Middle Eastern salad by using quinoa instead of bulgur. Our quinoa tabbouleh recipe features a protein-packed superfood, crisp veggies, fresh herbs and an easy lemon vinaigrette.

instructions.text: In a large saucepan, bring the water and 1/2 teaspoon of the salt to a boil. Add the quinoa, and reduce the heat. Cover and simmer until the liquid is absorbed, 12 to 15 minutes. Editor's Tip: If you're new to quinoa, get more tips on how to cook quinoa.
Remove from heat, and fluff the quinoa with a fork. Transfer the quinoa to a bowl, and let cool completely.

Add the parsley, cucumber, tomatoes, green onions and mint to the bowl with the cooled quinoa. In a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, pepper and remaining 1/2 teaspoon sea salt. Drizzle the dressing over the salad, and toss to coat. Let stand 30 minutes before serving. Refrigerate the leftovers.

recipes.title: Eggplant Fries
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: My kids love this snack

instructions.text: Preheat broiler. In a shallow bowl, whisk together eggs. In another shallow bowl, mix cheese, wheat germ and seasonings.

Trim ends of eggplant; cut eggplant lengthwise into 1/2-in.-thick slices. Cut slices lengthwise into 1/2-in. strips. Dip eggplant in eggs, then coat with cheese mixture. Place on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray.

Spritz eggplant with additional cooking spray. Broil 4 in. from heat for 3 minutes. Turn eggplant; spritz with additional cooking spray. Broil until golden brown, 1-2 minutes. Serve immediately with pasta sauce.

recipes.title: Fiesta Corn and Beans
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Bursting with southwestern flavors, the zesty veggie medley here can be served as a side dish or a meatless meal-in-one. The dollop of yogurt is a cool, creamy finishing touch.

ingredients.item: 1 medium green pepper, cut into 1-inch pieces
1 to 2 jalapeno peppers, seeded and sliced
2 cans (16 ounces each) kidney beans, rinsed and drained
Optional toppings: Plain yogurt and sliced ripe olives

instructions.text: In a large skillet, saute onion and peppers in oil until tender. Add garlic; cook 1 minute longer. Transfer to a 4-qt. slow cooker. Stir in the beans, corn, tomatoes and seasonings.
Cover and cook on low for 3-4 hours or until heated through. Serve with yogurt and olives if desired.

recipes.title: Sauteed Cabbage
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: When I was young, my family grew our own cabbages. It was fun to put the cabbage to use in the kitchen, just as I did with this comforting side. With potatoes, deviled eggs and cornbread, fried cabbage tastes like home.

instructions.text: In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Editor's Tip: Use a cast-iron skillet to achieve a nice, even browning on the cabbage.
Stir in the sugar, salt, pepper flakes and pepper.
Add the cabbage and water to the skillet. Cook for five to six minutes or until the cabbage is tender, stirring occasionally.

recipes.title: Garden-Fresh Rainbow Chard
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Chard, a member of the beet family, is prized for its green leaves and colorful stalks. Stir up these good-for-you greens with garlic and red onion.

ingredients.item: 1 medium red onion, halved and sliced
2 bunches rainbow Swiss chard, coarsely chopped (about 16 cups)

instructions.text: In a 6-qt. stockpot, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onion; cook and stir until tender, 2-3 minutes. Add garlic; cook 1 minute longer.
Add broth and chard; cook and stir until chard is tender, 5-6 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in lemon juice, salt and pepper.

recipes.title: Garlic Asiago Cauliflower Rice
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: The garlic seasoning and Asiago really pack a punch, making this five-ingredient low-carb side dish a real weeknight winner.

instructions.text: Using a box grater or a food processor fitted with the steel blade, finely shred cauliflower (about 6 cups).

In a large cast-iron or other heavy skillet, heat butter, oil and seasoning blend over medium-high heat. When butter is melted, stir in cauliflower, working in batches if necessary. Cook, uncovered, until tender, 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in cheese.

recipes.title: German Red Cabbage
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: This inexpensive red cabbage recipe makes a tender, tasty vegetable side dish. It's traditionally German, but it pairs well with all kinds of foods, in every season.

ingredients.item: 1 medium head red cabbage, shredded (about 8 cups)

instructions.text: In a large Dutch oven coated with cooking spray, cook and stir the onion and apple over medium heat for about five minutes until the onion is tender.
Stir in the cabbage, vinegar, sugar, salt and pepper. Cover the pan and cook over medium heat for about one hour, stirring occasionally, until the cabbage is tender. Serve the cabbage warm or cold.

recipes.title: Gouda Mixed Potato Mash
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Everything's better with cheese, right? This cheesy two-potato mash is no exception. If you cube the cheese, you’ll discover delicious pockets of melted cheese throughout the dish.

ingredients.item: 6 medium Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and cubed
2 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed

instructions.text: Place Yukon Gold and sweet potatoes in a Dutch oven; add water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cook, uncovered, 10-15 minutes or until tender. Drain; return to pan.
Mash potatoes, gradually adding milk. Stir in cheese, paprika, salt and pepper.

recipes.title: Green Beans in Red Pepper Sauce
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: For easy veggies, I make a simple sauce of sweet red peppers, almonds and parsley. We also like this sauce with zucchini or roasted cauliflower.

instructions.text: Place beans in a large saucepan; add water to cover. Bring to a boil. Cook, covered, until crisp-tender, 2-4 minutes. Drain. Pulse remaining ingredients in a food processor until smooth. Toss with beans.

recipes.title: Grilled Pattypans
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Just a few minutes and a handful of ingredients are all you’ll need for this scrumptious side dish. Hoisin sauce and rice wine vinegar give grilled pattypans Asian flair.

instructions.text: Place squash in a grill wok or basket coated with cooking spray. Grill, covered, over medium heat until tender, 4 minutes on each side.
Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients. Transfer squash to a serving bowl; add sauce and toss gently.

recipes.title: Grilled Street Corn
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Mexican food is my grandmother’s favorite. I wanted a perfect side for her legendary tacos, and this chile-lime grilled corn turned out to be just right.

instructions.text: Carefully peel back corn husks to within 1 in. of bottoms; remove silk. Rewrap corn in husks; secure with kitchen string. Rinse corn under water, moistening husks. Grill corn, covered, over medium heat 20-25 minutes or until tender, turning often.
In a small bowl, mix remaining ingredients until blended. Cut string from corn and peel back husks. Spread corn with sour cream mixture.

recipes.title: Honey Garlic Green Beans
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Green beans are a reliable standby, but they can seem ordinary on their own. Just a couple of extra ingredients give them a sweet and salty attitude. This is definitely my family's favorite way to enjoy them.

instructions.text: In a small bowl, whisk together honey, soy sauce, garlic cloves, salt and crushed red pepper flakes; set aside. Next, in a large saucepan or large bowl, fill half full with cold water and add ice. Then, in a 6-quart stockpot, bring 10 cups of water to a boil. Add beans in batches and cook uncovered, until beans are just crisp-tender, two to three minutes. Remove the beans and immediately drop them into ice water. Drain and pat dry.

Coat the stockpot with cooking spray. Add the beans and cook over high heat, stirring constantly, until slightly blistered, two to three minutes. Add the sauce; continue stirring until beans are coated and the sauce starts to evaporate slightly, an additional two to three minutes. Remove from heat and serve.

recipes.title: Honey-Thyme Butternut Squash
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: This golden, honey-sweetened squash is just as hearty and comforting as your favorite potato dish. With its bright color, it makes an attractive side for special autumn meals.

ingredients.item: 1 large butternut squash (about 5 pounds), peeled and cubed

instructions.text: In a large saucepan, bring 1 in. of water to a boil. Add squash; cover and cook for 10-15 minutes or until tender.
Drain. Mash squash with the remaining ingredients.

recipes.title: Couscous and Broccoli
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: This stovetop couscous and broccoli recipe delivers bright, citrusy flavor without dirtying a single extra pot.

ingredients.item: 4 cups fresh broccoli florets, cut into small pieces

instructions.text: In a large cast-iron or another heavy skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the broccoli; cook and stir until crisp-tender.
Add the couscous and garlic to the skillet; cook and stir for one to two minutes longer.

Stir in the chicken broth, lemon zest, lemon juice and seasonings; bring to a boil. Remove from the heat, add a lid and let the covered skillet stand until the broth is absorbed, 5 to 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Sprinkle with the toasted, slivered almonds.

recipes.title: Lemon Parmesan Orzo
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: A splash of lemon and a shower of chopped parsley make this orzo one of my family's most requested springtime sides. It's fantastic with chicken, pork and fish, or you can eat it on its own as a light lunch.

ingredients.item: 1 cup uncooked whole wheat orzo pasta

instructions.text: Cook orzo according to package directions; drain. Transfer to a small bowl; drizzle with oil. Stir in remaining ingredients.

recipes.title: Mashed Peppery Turnips
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: I created this recipe in an attempt to use up a great turnip harvest from our garden, and to lighten up one of our favorite dishes. By using turnips in place of potatoes, I made a low-carb side. Now we rarely serve plain mashed potatoes!

ingredients.item: 4 medium turnips (about 1 pound), peeled and cut into 1-1/4-in. pieces
1 large potato (about 3/4 pound), peeled and cut into 1-1/4-in. pieces

instructions.text: Place turnips, potato and enough water to cover in a large saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cook, uncovered, until tender, 15-20 minutes. Drain; return to pan.
Mash vegetables to desired consistency. Stir in remaining ingredients.

recipes.title: Mediterranean Cauliflower
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: I adapted a recipe I received from a friend to make this delicious

ingredients.item: 1 large head cauliflower, broken into florets
2 cans (14-1/2 ounces each) diced tomatoes with basil, oregano and garlic, drained
1/2 cup sliced green olives with pimientos

instructions.text: In a 6-qt. stockpot, place a steamer basket over 1 in. of water. Place cauliflower in basket. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; steam, covered, until crisp-tender, 4-6 minutes. Drain and return to pan.

Stir in tomatoes, olives, onions, pepper and salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, until cauliflower is tender and tomatoes are heated through, 3-5 minutes. Sprinkle with feta cheese before serving.

recipes.title: Olive Oil Mashed Potatoes with Pancetta
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Classic American mashed potatoes take a trip to Italy with the flavors of olive oil, garlic, and pancetta.

ingredients.item: 3 pounds Yukon Gold potatoes, peeled and cubed
1 tablespoon plus 1/4 cup olive oil, divided

instructions.text: Place potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer until tender, 15-20 minutes.
Meanwhile, in a large skillet, cook pancetta in 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat until crisp. Add garlic; cook for 1 minute longer. Remove from the heat.
Drain potatoes and transfer to a large bowl. Mash potatoes with remaining 1/4 cup oil. Stir in the parsley, pancetta mixture, salt and pepper.

recipes.title: Parmesan-Roasted Broccoli
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Broccoli and cheese are the simple but shining stars in this Parmesan-roasted broccoli recipe that really couldn't be easier

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 425°F. Cut the broccoli crowns into quarters, drizzle them with the olive oil, then sprinkle them with the salt, pepper and crushed red pepper flakes.
Place the broccoli in a parchment-lined 15x10x1-inch pan. Roast it until it's crisp-tender, 10 to 12 minutes.

Sprinkle the broccoli with garlic, and roast it five minutes longer. Then sprinkle on the Parmesan, and roast until the cheese is melted and the broccoli is tender, two to four minutes more. Finally, sprinkle it with the lemon zest. Editor’s Tip: Save time by using pre-minced garlic from a jar, but be careful to avoid the oil, as it can make the broccoli watery.

recipes.title: Quinoa and Peas
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: In this speedy and nutritious quinoa and peas bowl, protein-rich quinoa is paired with sweet green peas, drizzled with olive oil, and seasoned with salt and pepper.

instructions.text: In a large saucepan, bring the water to a boil. Add the quinoa. Reduce the heat, cover and simmer until the water is absorbed, 12 to 15 minutes. Remove the quinoa from the heat and fluff with a fork. Editor's Tip: If you'd like, add some extra seasoning to the cooking water so that the quinoa seeds absorb the flavor as they cook.

Meanwhile, in a large cast-iron or other heavy skillet, saute the onion in oil until tender, two to three minutes. Add the peas and cook, stirring until heated through. Mix in the cooked quinoa, salt and pepper. Sprinkle with walnuts. Editor's Tip: If you're using fresh peas, cook them until they're a bright green and they'll taste delicious.

recipes.title: Red Potatoes with Beans
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: You can serve this homey blend of fresh green beans, potato wedges and chopped red onion hot or cold. Either way, this easy side dish makes a pleasing accompaniment to Mom's meat loaf or almost any other meat.

ingredients.item: 6 small red potatoes, cut into wedges

instructions.text: Place the potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and cook until tender, 10-15 minutes.

Meanwhile, place green beans and water to cover them in a 2-qt. microwave-safe dish. Cover and microwave on high until tender, 6-8 minutes. Drain potatoes and beans; place in a bowl. Add onion and dressing; toss to coat.

recipes.title: Roasted Asparagus and Leeks
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: No vegetable says spring quite like asparagus. In this recipe, we combine pretty green spears with leeks. Crushed red pepper adds a bit of zest.

ingredients.item: 12 medium leeks (white portion only), halved lengthwise

instructions.text: Place asparagus and leeks on an ungreased 15x10x1-in. baking pan. Combine the remaining ingredients; pour over vegetables.
Bake at 400° for 20-25 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally.

recipes.title: Roasted Fennel and Peppers
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Fennel makes for a tasty change of pace in this versatile side that goes nicely with grilled meats. Best of all, it's full of flavor and easy to do

ingredients.item: 2 medium sweet red peppers, cut into 1-inch pieces
Fresh sage leaves, thinly sliced, optional

instructions.text: Place the fennel, peppers, onion and garlic in a 15x10x1-in. baking pan coated with cooking spray. Drizzle with oil; sprinkle with salt, pepper and rubbed sage. Toss to coat.
Bake, uncovered, at 425° until tender, 20-25 minutes, stirring twice. Garnish with fresh sage if desired.

recipes.title: Roasted Pumpkin and Brussels Sprouts
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: While traveling to Taiwan, I had the pleasure of trying a unique vegetable dish that included fresh pumpkin. It inspired me to roast pumpkin with Brussels sprouts.

ingredients.item: 1 medium pie pumpkin (about 3 pounds), peeled and cut into 3/4-inch cubes
1 pound fresh Brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved lengthwise

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°. In a large bowl, combine pumpkin, Brussels sprouts and garlic. In a small bowl, whisk oil, vinegar, salt and pepper; drizzle over vegetables and toss to coat.
Transfer to a greased 15x10x1-in. baking pan. Roast 35-40 minutes or until tender, stirring once. Sprinkle with parsley.

recipes.title: Roasted Rosemary Cauliflower
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Roasting the cauliflower really brings out its flavor in this side dish. Even folks who aren't cauliflower lovers like it this way.

ingredients.item: 1 medium head cauliflower (about 2-1/2 pounds), broken into florets
2 teaspoons minced fresh rosemary or 3/4 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 450°. Toss together all ingredients; spread in a greased 15x10x1-in. pan. Roast until tender and lightly browned, 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally.

recipes.title: Shredded Gingered Brussels Sprouts
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Even people who normally don't care for Brussels sprouts will ask for a second helping of these.

instructions.text: Trim Brussels sprouts. Cut sprouts lengthwise in half, then cut crosswise into thin slices.

Place a large cast-iron or other heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add Brussels sprouts; cook and stir until sprouts begin to brown lightly, 2-3 minutes. Add oil and toss to coat. Stir in onion, ginger, garlic and salt. Add water; reduce heat to medium and cook, covered, until vegetables are tender, 1-2 minutes. Stir in pepper.

recipes.title: Smoky Cauliflower
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: The smoked Spanish paprika gives a simple side of roasted cauliflower extra depth. This is definitely a favorite.

ingredients.item: 1 large head cauliflower, broken into 1-inch florets (about 9 cups)

instructions.text: Place cauliflower in a large bowl. Combine the oil, paprika and salt. Drizzle over cauliflower; toss to coat. Transfer to a 15x10x1-in. baking pan. Bake, uncovered, at 450° for 10 minutes.
Stir in garlic. Bake 10-15 minutes longer or until cauliflower is tender and lightly browned, stirring occasionally. Sprinkle with parsley.

recipes.title: Spaghetti Squash with Tomatoes and Olives
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: This squash is outstanding as a side dish, but you can also top it with canned tuna to create a simple, healthy main dish. It's easy and so tasty!  I like to use my own canned tomatoes for the best flavor.

ingredients.item: 1 medium spaghetti squash (about 4 pounds), halved, seeds removed
1/4 cup sliced green olives with pimientos, drained

instructions.text: Place squash in a 6- or 7-quart slow cooker, overlapping as needed to fit. Cook, covered, on low until tender, 5-7 hours.

Remove squash from slow cooker; drain any cooking liquid. Using a fork, separate the squash into strands resembling spaghetti, discarding the skin. Return strands to slow cooker. Stir in the tomatoes, olives, oregano, salt and pepper; cook on low until heated through, about 15 minutes. Top with cheese and basil.

recipes.title: Spiced Carrots & Butternut Squash
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: When I've got a lot going on, my slow cooker is my go-to tool for cooking veggies. The sweetness of the squash and carrots really complements the spicy seasonings.

ingredients.item: 5 large carrots, cut into 1/2-inch pieces (about 3 cups)
2 cups cubed peeled butternut squash (1-inch pieces)

instructions.text: Place carrots and squash in a 3-qt. slow cooker. In a small bowl, mix remaining ingredients; drizzle over vegetables and toss to coat. Cook, covered, on low 4-5 hours or until vegetables are tender. Gently stir before serving.

recipes.title: Spicy Grilled Eggplant
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: This side dish goes well with any meat you might also be grilling. Thanks to the Cajun seasoning, the zesty eggplant gets more attention than an ordinary veggie. —Greg Fontenot, The Woodlands, Texas

instructions.text: Brush eggplant slices with oil. Drizzle with lime juice; sprinkle with Cajun seasoning. Let stand 5 minutes.
Grill eggplant, covered, over medium heat or broil 4 in. from heat until tender, 4-5 minutes per side.

recipes.title: Spring Asparagus
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: This fresh and colorful side dish is delicious served warm or cold. I get lots of compliments on the homemade dressing.

ingredients.item: 1-1/2 pounds fresh asparagus, trimmed and cut into 2-inch pieces

instructions.text: In a large saucepan, bring 1 cup water to a boil. Add asparagus; cook, covered, until crisp-tender, 3-5 minutes. Drain; place in a large bowl. Add tomatoes; cover and keep warm.

Place vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, sugar, onion, salt and paprika in a blender; cover and process until smooth. While processing, gradually add oil in a steady stream. Toss with asparagus mixture. Top with almonds and, if desired, cheese.

recipes.title: Stewed Zucchini and Tomatoes
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: A fresh take on traditional vegetable sides, this make-ahead dish stars zucchini, tomatoes and green pepper. Bubbly cheddar cheese adds a down-home feel.

instructions.text: Place zucchini in a greased 3-qt. slow cooker. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Layer with onion, green pepper and tomatoes. In a small bowl, combine the soup, basil and remaining salt and pepper; spread over tomatoes.
Cover and cook on low for 3-4 hours or until vegetables are tender. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover and cook 30 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. If desired, top with fresh basil.

recipes.title: Sauteed Zucchini
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Sauteed zucchini is a near-perfect side dish. It’s light and fresh-tasting, goes with almost anything and best of all, it comes together in just minutes.

instructions.text: Place a large cast-iron or non-stick skillet, or a wok, over medium-high heat. Add the oil once the pan is hot, then the zucchini and garlic. Saute or stir-fry for five to six minutes (depending on the thickness of the slices), or until the zucchini is crisp-tender. Editor’s Tip: For extra visual interest, use a mixture of green zucchini and yellow summer squash. Alternatively, scallop-shaped “pattypan” squash or the deeply ribbed Romanesca heirloom variety can give you an interesting presentation with their differently shaped slices.

Sprinkle the seasonings over the zucchini, once they’ve reached the doneness and texture you prefer. Give them one final shake or stir, so the seasonings are evenly distributed among the slices, and serve immediately.

recipes.title: Crockpot Stuffing
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: This vegetarian Crockpot stuffing is a keeper. It has all the classic flavor, but it's cooked in a slow cooker for a moist, fluffy stuffing that leaves your oven free for other dishes.

ingredients.item: 6 cups cubed day-old whole wheat bread
1 can (14-1/2 ounces) reduced-sodium chicken broth or vegetable broth

instructions.text: Melt the butter in a skillet, and cook the onions and celery over medium heat until they're meltingly soft.

In a large bowl, toss together the bread cubes, salt, poultry seasoning, sage and pepper. Stir in the onion-celery mixture. In a separate small bowl, whisk together the broth and eggs, then add them to the bread mixture and toss to coat.
Coat a 3-quart slow cooker with cooking spray. Transfer the stuffing to the slow cooker, and cook on low for three to four hours, or until the stuffing reaches a temperature of 160°F.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Carrot Crisp
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: Sweet potatoes take a different twist in this whipped side dish that pairs them with carrots. Subtly sweet, it has just a hint of garlic, while the nut and crumb topping adds a fun crunch to any holiday meal.

ingredients.item: 4 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°. Place sweet potatoes and carrots in a large saucepan; add water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cook, covered, just until tender, 10-20 minutes. Drain; transfer to a blender or food processor. Working in batches, pulse with the next 6 ingredients until smooth. Pour into a greased 2-1/2-qt. baking dish.
Combine topping ingredients; sprinkle over sweet potato mixture. Bake, covered, for 30 minutes. Uncover; bake until heated through, 15-20 minutes longer.

recipes.title: Vegetable Barley Saute
recipes.source_note: Taste of Home - Diabetic Side Dishes
recipes.description: This wonderful side dish can easily be turned into a hearty entree by adding cooked chicken.

ingredients.item: 1 cup cut fresh green beans (2-inch pieces)

instructions.text: Prepare barley according to package directions. In a small bowl, combine water, soy sauce and cornstarch until smooth; set aside.

In a large skillet or wok, saute garlic in oil for 15 seconds. Add carrots and beans; stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add green onion; stir-fry 1 minute longer. Stir soy sauce mixture; stir into skillet. Bring to a boil; cook and stir until thickened, about 1 minute. Add barley; heat through. If desired, stir in cashews.

recipes.title: Buttermilk Mashed Potatoes
recipes.description: Buttermilk mashed potatoes are just as creamy and fluffy as traditional mashed potatoes and require little (or no!) butter. Our recipe includes a little garlic to add a sweet, rich character to the tangy mash.

ingredients.item: 2 pounds potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes

instructions.text: In a large saucepan, combine the potatoes, water, broth and garlic. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat, and simmer, covered, until the potatoes are tender, 12 to 15 minutes. Editor's Tip: Pierce a few potatoes with a fork to check if they're finished cooking. If the fork slides in easily, the potatoes are tender enough to mash.

Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, heat the buttermilk until warm. Editor's Tip: Buttermilk can curdle if it's boiled or heated too quickly. It's not unsafe to eat—curdling here just means that the milk proteins have coagulated and separated from the whey. However, it does look off-putting. Prevent curdling by using gentle heat. Remove the saucepan from the heat well before it comes to a boil.

Drain the potatoes and garlic. Mash them with the warmed buttermilk. Editor's Tip: For the smoothest mashed potatoes, use a potato ricer or food mill to mash the potatoes. For a more rustic mash, use a handheld potato masher. Avoid using a food processor or blender, which can overmix the starches and create a gummy texture.
Stir in the onions, salt and pepper. If desired, serve with butter and additional green onions.

recipes.title: Grilled Broccoli
recipes.description: Coating broccoli in a lemon juice marinade and a layer of Parmesan, then hitting it with a smoky char, makes for a showstopper of a grilled broccoli side dish.

ingredients.item: Optional: Grilled lemon slices and red pepper flakes

instructions.text: Place the broccoli in a large bowl. Combine the lemon juice, oil, salt and pepper, then drizzle the mixture over the broccoli and toss to coat. Let it stand for 30 minutes.

Toss the broccoli again, then drain it through a colander, discarding the marinade. Place the cheese in a small shallow bowl. Add the broccoli, a few pieces at a time, tossing after each addition to coat the broccoli with cheese.

Prepare the grill for indirect heat using a drip pan. Place the broccoli over the drip pan on an oiled grill rack. Grill it, covered, over indirect medium heat for 8 to 10 minutes on each side or until the broccoli is crisp-tender and beginning to singe lightly. If desired, garnish it with grilled lemon slices and red pepper flakes before serving.

recipes.title: Roasted Carrots and Onions
recipes.description: Season roasted carrots and onions with thyme, pepper and a splash of vinegar for a lovely, balanced vegetable side dish.

instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 450°F. Place the carrots, onions and garlic on two greased 15x10x1-inch baking pans. Drizzle the vegetables with olive oil and vinegar. Sprinkle with thyme, salt and pepper; gently toss to coat.

Cover the pans with foil and bake for 20 minutes. Remove the foil, stir the vegetables and return them to the oven. Bake, uncovered, for another 10 minutes; stir again. Bake for a final 10 minutes, or until the onions are soft and the carrots are crisp-tender. If desired, sprinkle with fresh thyme.

recipes.title: Seasoned Green Beans
recipes.description: A delicious meal is more than just an impressive main. Our seasoned green beans prove just how effective a knockout side dish can be, without taking more than 10 minutes to make.

instructions.text: Nestle the green beans in a steamer basket, and place the basket in a saucepan over 1 inch of water. Bring the water to a boil. Cover and steam the green beans until crisp-tender, seven to eight minutes. Editor’s Tip: Make sure your green beans are properly washed before steaming them. Discard any fully brown green beans.
In a small bowl, stir the melted butter, seasoned salt, chili powder, garlic powder and onion powder together until well combined.
Drain the green beans, and place them in a bowl. Pour the butter mixture over the green beans, and toss everything to evenly coat.

recipes.title: Grilled Stuffed Zucchini
recipes.description: Grilled stuffed zucchini is filled with a light and savory blend of sauteed vegetables, breadcrumbs, melty cheese and fresh mint.

instructions.text: Cut each zucchini in half lengthwise, then scoop out the flesh to create a 1/4-inch shell. Brush the cut sides with two teaspoons of olive oil and set aside. Finely chop the scooped-out zucchini flesh. Editor’s Tip: A small spoon or melon baller is perfect for carving neat and tidy zucchini boats.

In a large skillet, saute the zucchini flesh and onion in the remaining oil. Add the minced garlic and cook for one minute longer. Add the bread crumbs and cook, stirring frequently, until they're golden brown, about two minutes.
Remove the skillet from the heat. Stir in the shredded mozzarella, chopped mint and salt. Spoon the filling evenly into the zucchini shells, then sprinkle each with grated Parmesan cheese.

Grill the stuffed zucchini, covered, over medium heat until the zucchini shells are tender, about 8 to 10 minutes. Editor’s Tip: The zucchini are ready when they can easily be pierced with a fork or the tip of a knife.

recipes.title: Succotash
recipes.description: This succotash recipe has everything that makes Southern cooking irresistible: ham hocks, beans, vegetables and herbs. It's easily customizable too, so you can add pretty much anything from your vegetable garden.

ingredients.item: 1 package (10 ounces) crowder peas, thawed, or 1 can (15-1/2 ounces) black-eyed peas, drained
1 cup sliced fresh or frozen okra
Optional: Snipped fresh dill and chives

instructions.text: Place the ham hock in a Dutch oven or large saucepan and add enough water to come halfway up the side of the ham hock. Cover and simmer until tender, about 1 hour and 30 minutes.

Remove the ham bone from the Dutch oven, reserving 1 cup of the cooking liquid. Let the ham stand until it's cool enough to handle. Remove the meat from the bone and return it to the pan, along with the reserved cooking liquid. Discard the bone and remaining broth. Editor's Tip: Save the leftover broth to use as the base for a homemade soup.
Add the tomatoes, beans, peas, corn, green pepper, onion, ketchup and seasonings. Simmer, uncovered, for 45 minutes. Add the okra, and simmer, uncovered, until tender, about 15 minutes.
Discard the bay leaf before serving. Garnish with dill and chives, if desired.

recipes.title: Macaroni With Tomato Sauce
recipes.source_note: Simple Italian Cookery (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe: Maccheroni al Sugo

instructions.text: Boil the water until it makes big bubbles. Add salt, then break the macaroni and put it in. Cover the saucepan and boil for fifteen minutes. The saucepan should not be too small, otherwise the macaroni will stick to the bottom.
Prepare the sauce as follows:

Take a good slice of ham fat, and chop very fine with it a piece of onion, a piece of celery, and some parsley. Then put this into a frying-pan and cook until the grease is colored. (If desired, add a small lump of butter.) When well colored add two tablespoons of tomato paste dissolved in a little hot water. Boil all together for fifteen minutes.

Drain the macaroni, and put it into the frying-pan with the sauce, mix well with fork and spoon over the fire, so that the macaroni will be thoroughly seasoned, then add three tablespoons of grated Parmesan cheese, mix again, and serve.
If no tomato paste is available make the tomato sauce as follows:

Chop up fine one-quarter of an onion, a piece of celery the length of a finger, two or three basil-leaves, and a small bunch of parsley. Slice seven or eight tomatoes (fresh or canned), add salt and pepper, and put all on together to cook in four tablespoons of good olive-oil. Stir occasionally, and when it becomes as thick as cream, strain, and add the macaroni as before directed.

notes: Original Italian: Maccheroni al Sugo

recipes.title: Ravioli Of Curds And Spinach
recipes.source_note: Simple Italian Cookery (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

ingredients.item: bunch of spinach 1/2 pound of curds

instructions.text: Cook the spinach, drain, and chop up fine, add the curds, one egg, salt and pepper, dash of nutmeg, and a little grated cheese. Add to the paste, and boil as before.

recipes.title: Sauce Bechamel
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Rub the butter and flour together, add the stock and the milk and stir until boiling; add the salt and pepper, take from the fire and add the beaten yolk of the egg, heat for a moment over hot water, and it is ready for use.

recipes.title: Cream Or White Sauce
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Rub the butter and flour together, add the milk cold and stir until boiling; add the pepper and salt and it is ready for use.

recipes.title: Brown Butter Sauce
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

ingredients.item: fuls of butter 1 teaspoonful of mushroom catsup 1 tablespoonful of vinegar 4 tablespoonfuls of stock

instructions.text: Melt the butter, brown it and then skim; pour it carefully into a clean saucepan, add the vinegar, catsup and stock, boil a minute, and it is ready for use.

recipes.title: Sauce Perigueux
recipes.source_note: Many Ways for Cooking Eggs (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Chop the truffles and put them with the bay leaf and wine in a saucepan on the back of the stove. Rub half the butter and flour together, add the stock, stir until boiling and add one teaspoonful of kitchen bouquet, the salt and pepper, and then the truffles; cook ten minutes, add the remaining quantity of butter and use at once.

recipes.title: Potato Filling
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Put the beaten egg into the mashed potatoes and mix well. Melt the butter in a large skillet and saute the onion and celery. Stir in the bread crumbs to toast for a few minutes, stirring constantly. Add all the other ingredients, combine with the potatoes and mix thoroughly.

recipes.title: Horseradish Sauce For Boiled Beef Or Corned Beef
recipes.source_note: Pennsylvania Dutch Cooking (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage Italian recipe

instructions.text: Melt butter, remove from heat and stir in flour. Add the milk gradually, stirring constantly, until mixture boils and thickens. Add salt and pepper and cook for 3 minutes more. recipes.title: Macaroni With Tomato Sauce
recipes.source_note: Simple Italian Cookery (Project Gutenberg, public domain)
recipes.description: Vintage recipe: Maccheroni al Sugo

instructions.text: Boil the water until it makes big bubbles. Add salt, then break the macaroni and put it in. Cover the saucepan and boil for fifteen minutes. The saucepan should not be too small, otherwise the macaroni will stick to the bottom.
Prepare the sauce as follows:

Take a good slice of ham fat, and chop very fine with it a piece of onion, a piece of celery, and some parsley. Then put this into a frying-pan and cook until the grease is colored. (If desired, add a small lump of butter.) When well colored add two tablespoons of tomato paste dissolved in a little hot water. Boil all together for fifteen minutes.

Drain the macaroni, and put it into the frying-pan with the sauce, mix well with fork and spoon over the fire, so that the macaroni will be thoroughly seasoned, then add three tablespoons of grated Parmesan cheese, mix again, and serve.
If no tomato paste is available make the tomato sauce as follows:

Chop up fine one-quarter of an onion, a piece of celery the length of a finger, two or three basil-leaves, and a small bunch of parsley. Slice seven or eight tomatoes (fresh or canned), add salt and pepper, and put all on together to cook in four tablespoons of good olive-oil. Stir occasionally, and when it becomes as thick as cream, strain, and add the macaroni as before directed.

notes: Original: Maccheroni al Sugo

recipes.title: Onion-Soup-Based Swedish Meatball Sauce
recipes.description: Creamy Swedish-style sauce for meatballs, with family modifications noted.

ingredients.prep_note: handwritten note: 1/2 container of sour cream

instructions.text: Combine gravy and soup mixes with water.
Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
Simmer for one minute.
Reduce heat to low and add sour cream.
Serve over meatballs.

notes: Handwritten modifications suggest reducing quantities for a smaller batch
Original recipe calls for 2 cups sour cream, annotation suggests 1/2 container

recipes.title: To Pickle Cucumbers
recipes.description: A colonial cucumber pickle with spiced wine vinegar.

instructions.text: Let your cucumbers be small, fresh gathered, and free from spots.
Make a pickle of salt and water, strong enough to bear an egg.
Boil the pickle and skim it well, and then pour it upon your cucumbers, and stive them down for twenty four hours.
Then strain them out into a cullender, and dry them well with a cloth.
Take the best white wine vinegar, with cloves, sliced mace, nutmeg, white pepper corns, long pepper, and races of ginger.
Boil them up together, and then clap the lid on tight.

notes: Original 1796 recipe
'Races of ginger' = whole ginger root

recipes.title: For Preserving Quinces
recipes.description: Colonial method for preserving quinces with oranges in sugar syrup.

ingredients.prep_note: cut up and mixed with quince

instructions.text: Take a peck of Quinces, pare them, take out the core with a sharp knife; boil parings and cores with two pound frost grapes, in 3 quarts water, boil the liquor an hour and an half, or till it is thick.
Strain it through a coarse hair sieve, add one and a quarter pound sugar to every pound of quince.
Put the sugar into the syrup, scald and skim it till it is clear, put the quinces into the syrup.
Cut up two oranges and mix with the quince, hang them over a gentle fire for five hours.
Then put them in a stone pot for use, set them in a dry cool place.

notes: Original 1796 recipe
Frost grapes are a native American grape species

recipes.title: The American Citron (Watermelon Rind Preserve)
recipes.description: An early American preserve made from watermelon rind - a uniquely American adaptation using native fruit.

ingredients.prep_note: from large watermelon not too ripe, cut into small pieces

instructions.text: Take the rine of a large watermelon not too ripe, cut it into small pieces, take two pound of loaf sugar, one pint of water, put it all into a kettle.
Let it boil gently for four hours.
Then put it into pots for use.

notes: Original 1796 recipe
This is an early American adaptation - using watermelon rind as a substitute for imported citron

recipes.title: To Make Marmalade
recipes.description: Colonial quince marmalade recipe.

instructions.text: To two pounds of quinces, put three quarters of a pound of sugar and a pint of springwater.
Then put them over the fire, and boil them till they are tender.
Then take them up and bruise them; then put them into the liquor, let it boil three quarters of an hour.
Then put it into your pots or faucers.

notes: Original 1796 recipe

recipes.title: For Preserving Strawberries
recipes.description: Colonial method for preserving whole strawberries in syrup.

instructions.text: Take two quarts of Strawberries, squeeze them through a cloth, add half a pint of water and two pound of sugar.
Put it into a sauce pan on a chaffing dish, let your sauce pan on the fire, scald and skim it.
Take two pound of Strawberries with stems, let your sauce pan on a chaffing dish, put as many Strawberries into the dish as you can with the stems up without bruising them.
Let them boil for about ten minutes, then take them out gently with a fork and put them into a stone pot for use.
When you have done the whole turn the syrup into the pot, when hot; set them in a cool place for use.

notes: Original 1796 recipe
Handle gently to preserve whole berries

recipes.title: Currant Jelly
recipes.description: Colonial currant jelly preserved with brandy-dipped paper.

instructions.text: Having stripped the currants from the stalks, put them in a stone jar, stop it close, set it in a kettle of boiling water, half way the jar.
Let it boil half an hour, take it out and (strain the juice through a coarse hair sieve, to a pint of juice put a pound of sugar.
Set it over a fine quick fire in a preserving pan, or a bell-metal skillet, keep stirring it all the time till the sugar be melted, then skim the skum off as fast as it rises.

When the jelly is very clear and fine, pour it into earthen or china cups, when cold, cut white papers just the bigness of the top of the pot, and lay on the jelly, dip those papers in brandy, then cover the top of the pot and prick it full of holes.
Set it in a dry place; you may put some into glasses for present use.

notes: Original 1796 recipe
Cover with brandy-dipped paper to preserve

recipes.title: To Keep Green Peas till Christmas
recipes.description: Colonial method for preserving green peas through winter using mutton suet.

instructions.text: Take young peas, shell them, put them in a cullender to drain.
Then lay a cloth four or five times double on a table, then spread them on, dry them very well.
Have your bottles ready, fill them, cover them with mutton suet fat when it is a little soft.
Fill the necks almost to the top, cork them, tie a bladder and a leather over them and set them in a dry cool place.

notes: Original 1796 recipe
Colonial preservation method for winter storage

recipes.title: To Boil Asparagus
recipes.description: Colonial method for preparing asparagus with toast and butter.

ingredients.prep_note: cut into small pieces, for garnish

instructions.text: Scrape asparagus, cut them even lengths and tie them in small bundles.
Put them into boiling water with salt in it.
When tender, take them up carefully, dip the toast in the asparagus water.
Lay it in the bottom of your dish; then lay the heads of the asparagus on it, with the white ends outwards.
Pour a little melted butter over the heads; cut an orange into small pieces, and stick them between for garnish.

notes: Original 1796 recipe

recipes.title: Curried Corn with Chile
recipes.description: Sauteed corn with curry powder, green chiles, and heavy cream.

ingredients.item: salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Melt the butter in a heavy skillet and add the garlic and onion. Cook until the onion is translucent.
Using a sharp knife, cut the corn kernels off the cobs, then scrape the cobs to remove the corn milk. Add the kernels and corn milk to skillet.
Sprinkle with the curry powder, salt, and pepper; add the cream. Partially cover and simmer 20 to 30 minutes over very low heat, or until the chiles cook 5 minutes longer, and serve.

recipes.title: Cornfetti Casserole
recipes.description: Colorful corn casserole with green chiles, cream cheese, and cheddar.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Mix together all the ingredients except the cheese and chiles and pour the cornmeal mixture with chiles in a greased 2-quart casserole.
Top with the grated cheese. Bake for 1 hour or until set.
Variation: Add 1 cup sour cream and 1 jar (2 oz.) chopped pimientos to the mixture.

recipes.title: Apple and Eve Beets
recipes.description: Baked beet and apple casserole with honey, lemon juice, and cinnamon.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 325°F.
Butter a casserole. Mix all the ingredients, except the butter, into the casserole.
Dot with butter over the top. Cover and bake for 45 minutes.

recipes.title: Southwest Baked Beans
recipes.description: Baked beans with green chiles, bacon, and southwestern spices.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
In a large mixing bowl, combine all the ingredients except the bacon; mix thoroughly.
Pour into a 2½- or 3-quart ovenproof casserole or bean pot.
Top with the bacon and cut 1-inch slits in it.
Bake for 1 hour.

recipes.title: Broccoli-Green Chile Delight
recipes.description: A creamy broccoli casserole with green chiles and cheese.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Saute the onion and celery in oil; add the thawed broccoli. Simmer over low heat 15 minutes.
Add the soup, milk, water, rice, cheese spread, and chiles; bring mixture to a boil.
Pour into a buttered 1½-quart casserole.
Bake until well heated, for 28 minutes or until bubbly.

recipes.title: Curried Corn with Chile
recipes.description: Corn kernels cooked with curry powder, cream, and green chiles.

ingredients.item: salt and freshly ground black pepper

instructions.text: Melt the butter in a heavy skillet and add the garlic and onion. Cook until the onion is translucent.
Using a sharp knife, cut the kernels off the cobs; then use a dull knife to scrape the corn milk. Add the kernels and corn milk.
Sprinkle with the curry powder, salt, and pepper; add the cream.
Partially cover and simmer 20 to 30 minutes over very low heat. In the chiles, cook 5 minutes longer, and serve.

recipes.title: Cornfetti Casserole
recipes.description: A colorful corn casserole with green chiles and cheese.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Mix together all the ingredients except the cheese and chiles and layer the corn mixture with chiles in a greased 2-quart casserole.
Top with the grated cheese.
Bake for 1 hour or until set.

notes: Variation: Add 1 cup sour cream and 1 jar (2 oz.) chopped pimentos to the mixture.

recipes.title: Garbanzos Calientes
recipes.description: Hot chickpeas sauteed with onion, garlic, tomato, and green chiles.

ingredients.item: canned green chiles, chopped (or more to taste)

instructions.text: Heat the oil in a skillet and saute the onion, garlic, tomato, chile, and chile powder over low heat about 10 minutes.
Add the garbanzos and salt; simmer 30 minutes.

recipes.title: Mexicali Spuds
recipes.description: Potatoes mixed with bacon, sour cream, and green chiles.

instructions.text: Fry the bacon, drain on paper towels, and crumble.
Cook the potatoes in salted boiling water until tender; drain and cool for 45 minutes.
Mix together the crumbled bacon, cream, sour cream, green chiles, and onions.
Fold into the potatoes and season to taste with salt, pepper, and garlic salt.
Can be served immediately or can be chilled.

recipes.title: Green Chile Mashed Potatoes
recipes.description: Creamy mashed potatoes with green chiles and cheese.

ingredients.item: servings instant or fresh mashed potatoes
canned or frozen green chiles, chopped

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Prepare the mashed potatoes according to the instructions.
Stir in the remaining ingredients. Spread the mixture in a buttered pan and bake 10 to 15 minutes or until the cheese has melted and blended with the potatoes.

missing_inputs: 1/4 cup canned or frozen green chiles, chopped

recipes.title: Roundup Mashed Potatoes
recipes.description: Mashed potatoes baked with chiles, cheese, and egg whites.

ingredients.item: prepared mashed potatoes, fresh or instant

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Chop the chiles. Combine the chiles with the mashed potatoes, egg yolks, and cheeses. Mix well.
Beat the egg whites until stiff and fold them into the potato mixture.
Turn into a 2-quart casserole and bake for 40 minutes or until browned.

recipes.title: Zucchini Exquisito!
recipes.description: Fried zucchini baked in a casserole with green chile sauce and cheese.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Pour the oil to a depth of 1/2 inch in a skillet and heat to 450 degrees. Fry the sliced zucchini in the oil until tender and transparent on both sides. Drain on paper towels.

Grind together the cilantro, chiles, tomatoes, garlic, and salt in a blender or mortar and pestle. Combine the tomato puree and tomatillos in a saucepan and add the herb mixture. Cook, stirring, 5 minutes.
Spread the cooked zucchini in the bottom of a 13x9x2-inch sprayed casserole. Pour the sauce over the zucchini and top with the cheese. Cover and bake 45 minutes.

recipes.title: Creamy Vegetable Melange
recipes.description: A creamy vegetable casserole with zucchini, corn, and green chiles.

ingredients.item: green chiles, chopped (or more to taste)

instructions.text: Make a white sauce by combining the margarine, flour, seasonings, and milk over low heat.
Turn the heat up to medium and cook the sauce until it thickens, stirring often.

recipes.title: Noodles with Green Chile
recipes.description: Egg noodles baked with cottage cheese, onion, and green chiles.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Mix the noodles with all the ingredients except the Parmesan cheese and turn into a greased 1-quart casserole.
Sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese and dot with butter.
Bake for 30 minutes.
